description:
We came here before a movie at AMC Kabuki on a Friday for dinner and enjoyed our meal.

It wasn't very busy when we arrived at 6:00pm, but as the time went on, more and more people started trickling in... though didn't completely fill up the place. 

The staff was very attentive to our needs and constantly checked on us and filling our water glasses.

Being gluten sensitive, I was appreciative that their menu had notes of what was gluten free and what they could make gf upon request.  I was pleasantly surprised that their chicken wings were gluten free too ( which I thought was good and had a good sweet/spicy sauce).

I also got the pad nam prick pow, which was pretty good too. My only complaint was that some of the pieces of chicken in my dish seemed a little rubbery. However the food had some great flavors.

I would probably come here again to try out the tom yum soup and a flat rice noodle dish (which is my go tos) to see how I really feel about this place.
author: Gita r.

description:
OUT ****ing rageous !!! With tip 15 bucks for the skimpiest portion I have ever gotten in my life. If you wanna get screwed on their "lunch special", step right up cause yer gonna. This is NOT the way 99% of Thai establishments operate.

I had a tiny, and I mean tiny bowl of veggies. Lets do the inventory ok. 2 pieces of broccoli, ditto carrot slices, maybe six small pieces of cabbage & NO cauliflower as advertised.

I couldn't wait to get home to report this nonsense to the community. Bring back the last incarnation "Neecha" Thai. They had it going on! I would be afraid to come back her for the evening proceedings because prices are probably twice as much. The food was good, no complaints there, service attentive but WTF. I'm still in shock but laughing.
author: Henry K.

description:
I have come to Sweet Lime a few times before or after going to movies at Kabuki. The restaurant is small, but I've never had a problem being seated immediately. They also have allowed us to sit when we are still waiting for a few people, which is really nice. The ambience is pleasant and calming, and the restaurant is quiet. 

The food is very good- the Panang curry is flavored well, although the fact that they can't give it to you without pork is really disappointing. The pork itself is tough, chewy, and flavorless, and I would recommend eating around the pork if you get this dish. The fresh rolls are good, and so is the chicken satay. The pad kee mao is very good- full of crunchy fresh veggies (although not a lot of noodles as a result of this). 

Service is not the best, both times one individual has had to wait for their meal long after the rest have been brought out. It would be better to bring them all out at once, or warn us if it's going to be a time consuming dish to prepare. Although, on one occasion, it was the same dish I had ordered and my friend didn't get hers until over 20 minutes later. 

Overall, decent Thai food, shoddy service, but still a solid option if you're in the area.
author: Ayushi A.

description: Good food. Ordered online. Took quite sometime for them to prepare it. Food was of decent proportions. Flavors were somewhat mediocre though. I also think that experiencing being at a restaurant helps the flavor of the food. Decent....not amazing.
author: Olive R.

description:
It was raining really hard when I was walking by this popular Thai spot in Lower Pac Heights close to J-Town. My umbrella had two of its spikes broken by aggressive gusts of wind, so I was already in a foul mood when I was getting drenched by a torrential downpour. So when I entered to grab a late dinner here, all I wanted was a little table where I could throw down my sorry excuse for an umbrella and have something comforting to eat. Fortunately there was a table open in a blind corner of the restaurant where I was certain I would be ignored. To the staff's credit, I wasn't. It must have been the inclement weather that led my desire to order some soup.

The $13 Tom Kha with Chicken satisfied that need for the most part as it was a warm broth of coconut milk, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, lemongrass, and lime juice (photo: http://bit.ly/2ryJETB). The poultry was present and accounted for, but it was missing any seasoning or spicy kick that would have made it truly memorable. I needed something to chew on, so I ordered the $9 Fresh Roll which added avocado to the standard lettuce, mint, carrot, and cucumber in the rice paper wrapper and peanut sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2KTIiuS). Good and the avocado was a nice touch, but hell, it was time to reassemble my umbrella for that long, wet walk home.

FOOD - 3 stars...good but not exceptional Thai fare
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...spacious with big pictures of limes (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kce84M)
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...smiles
TOTAL - 3 stars...not my favorite Thai place in town, wet or dry
author: Ed U.

description:
Return lunch visit with my friends on July 27.  We have eaten here 4 or 5 times and never disappointed. This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay Area. We started with the Miang Kham app ( 7 ingredients) that you mix and create to your own taste. Try the calamari rings.  Man they are tasty, great flavor and chili sauce.  I could eat the entire plate. Got the Thai Spring roll for my son, which is a baby roll that kids will like, table shared pad thai, pad prik khing and noodles in green curry. 
Enjoy !
author: Jeff R.

description:
We both had a great meal here. We were hungry. I got the vegan taro rolls to start. They were very good, practically greaseless and came to the table hot with a delicious dipping sauce. My wife got a lunch special with a tasty curry rice and chicken dish that came with a vegetarian fresh roll. I had the yellow curry with just vegetables and brown rice. The curry sauce itself was fantastic- completely full of warm flavors without being particularly spicy. 

Service was friendly and efficient. We witnessed a waitress deal with a customer in a wheelchair kindly and competently. The atmosphere is pleasant. The food was on the more expensive side but totally worth it.
author: Marco M.

description:
Great local little Thai restaurant. It's got wonderful large windows, so when I came on a summer Thursday evening ~7pm, the sun was streaming in nicely. This is one of those sit down restaurants where things are plated nicely. 

I ordered Pad kee mao. It was served up real quick and cooked on a super hot wok fire, which is the tastiest way to eat any kind of Asian stir fry. None of that lukewarm gas stove nonsense. Bonus points right there. 

The chicken bits and fat a*# noodles were delicious and chewy. Hot. Oily. With fresh Thai basil thrown in last minute. Mmm. This is where I'll go for a relatively affordable dinner when I'm getting feels for Thai food. 

I'll have to come back to try more. Give this place a shot!
author: Vivian L.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday and the place was pretty filled. I came because one of the yelp reviews had a pretty cheap menu. The menu on yelp was wrong, it's normal pricy Thai. 
I asked for my pad see ew  spicy but it wasn't spicy at all. Not sure if it was my taste buds but I like my Thai real spicy! I asked for more spices and they had lots to offer. The dish was very good a little on the smaller side in my opinion for Thai. 
Overall good place but I'll probably try something else next time.
author: Megan M.

description:
Made a reservation here for 7 people on Friday night at 7pm with no problem. Hidden gem in the city as the food tastes seriously SO FRESH! They source their ingredients straight from Thailand and have the best chili house sauce I've ever had. Super spicy and super super good. I think I ate their whole jar of it and was left wanting more. I got the green papaya salad which was amazing and the pineapple fried rice which was SO GOOD and even came in a pineapple.
My friends and I will definitely be back. Expect an evening of great service, tasty food, and a beautiful ambiance. Also a great date spot!
author: Gina H.

description: Fresh flavor. Great service. Clean space. Relaxed atmosphere. Tasty and not too oily like other Thai restaurants.
author: Kassandra K.

description:
Nice convenient location with very well made thaifood 
 offers Good vegetarian options and vegetarian chicken satay
Good service and  atmosphere
author: Stevanne A.

description: Great Thai food! I've been hunting for a new delivery place since my last favorite closed, and sweet lime wins the prize. Panang chicken and duck has really nice flavor and the meat is tender and delicious. The sweet lime Suki is spicy with a hint of sweet and acid for a balanced bite. The fried rolls are perfectly crispy. Yummm.
author: Suki B.

description:
Sweet Lime offers very good Thai food and we enjoyed our lunch for four. 

The ingredients are fresh and appetizers like grilled whole squid ($13) are expertly prepared and presented.

While the cost of food keeps going up and Sweet Lime doesn't skimp on using quality vegetables (wood ear mushrooms) and delicious meats (the duck was a standout along with the grilled squid), I think their prices are a touch high, especially for lunch.

Case in point was the green curry duck ($15) which was a smaller portion, a little bigger than a cup of soup, side Jasmine rice in a sweet heart shape and a simple salad.

Every dish, though, was on point and the flavors were phenomenal including the dessert my little boy and his friend shared: fried banana ice cream with roasted coconut ($8).

I had a micro bite of the coconut ice cream and it was complex and creamy, not too sweet. 

Two appetizers the boys had, Spicy Angel Wings, ($10), the calamari, a small papaya salad ($9) and the green curry duck with assorted drinks (teas, fresh limeade) plus dessert was $82.50 plus tip for the four of us.

Service was attentive until the end of our meal then it fell apart: It took close to 10 minutes to get the check, the owner and server were fussing over a demanding couple who moved tables and seemed to have the kitchen in a stir.

But after we paid the check and left, our kind server ran a half a block after us with a shopping bag we left behind. That was very thoughtful.

A solid 4 stars, with a reservation about lunch pricing.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Service here was very friendly and prompt!  I ordered the pad si-ew and my boyfriend ordered kao pad (fried rice).  We both enjoyed our meals and thought it was on-par with the Thai food we've had elsewhere in the US (but not as good as the meals we've had in Thailand). 

The star of the meal was the mango sticky rice (seasonal).  The dish was served with plenty of mango and the rice was still warm when it came to the table.  I think I ate it in silence for the first few minutes because I was really having a moment.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Amazing restaurant with very friendly owners. We shared the pad kee mow, papaya salad, green curry,  and the chicken stir fry. All extremely fresh and really good hot sauce!! Eat the hot sauce!!!!!!!
author: Brett I.

description:
Was in a rush. They had just opened 5pm. 

Only ordered starters and Thai tea   They didn't means at all 

Service was amazing and friendly and food was delicious 

Can't wait to go back and try full meal
author: Phil W.

description: We have been to this Thai restaurant several times and it was very good. No. More than that. Bordering on excellent.  I hope this was just an off night, a different chef, something temporary. It was mediocre, lacking in flavor, bordering on boring. There were three of us.  We tried each other's dishes and it was blah all around.  One tip. Be careful to only order the brown rice you will eat, not a serving per person. We paid $9 for rice and only ate a little of it.  One serving would have been enough.  Disappointed in the food.  Excellent service though.
author: Laura S.

description: Ordered takeout 45 minutes before they closed and the yelp system scheduled it for the morning. I didn't notice that and showed up to get my takeout. The very kind people here whipped up my food in 5 minutes anyway! Extremely kind, very adaptable, and the tom khan and pad thai was tasty!
author: Ben M.

description:
Came here with friends and had a great time! Our reservation for 6 people was all laid out, and we were seated with no problem even though we were a little bit late. Would definitely come here again. 

Street parking was a bit hard to find, but park a few streets over and up, and walk over - there is definitely street parking if you look around a bit.
author: Jan Z.

description: One of my patrons suggested I try this Thai restaurant and I absolutely adored the aura of the decor. The employees were polite, respectful and delicious. I tried a pineapple curry which I've never had before and it was like desert melting in my mouth. I enjoyed every bite and the full on experience.Highly recommended.
author: Kristy U.

description: We stumbled upon this place for lunch today and it was a total success!! The prices were reasonable, the food was authentic, fresh and delicious. We had the spring rolls (highly recommend) avocado salad and pad see ew. They also have happy hour pretty much all day for inexpensive mimosas and beer. It is a family run restaurant and they make all of their own spices and sauces. Definitely check this out if you don't feel like waiting in line for Sweet Maple !
author: Amanda J.

description:
I'd say this place is like a 3.5 

The food was OK - we got the general go-to's for anyone whose got trust issues with corner street Thai restaurants: pad thai and pad see ew. They were both pretty decent - not the best I've had nor the worst. But at the price? It was a bit over what I would have paid for that amount of food at that quality. Aside from that, service was generally attentive and we had a rather strange encounter with the owner of the restaurant who behaved like a quasi car-salesman type trying to get us to try out different things on the menu aside from what we ordered.
author: David Y.

description:
I love Thai food and though I've been wanting to try out this place that's really close to my church - I haven't done it for some reason. So on Good Friday - while waiting for the confession line to subside - I decided to finally go to Sweet Lime and try their food.

I ordered the Pad Kee Mao (spicy basil pan fried wide noodles) and was blown away. I have tried so many different Thai restaurants in the city (and around the world) - I've even been to Bangkok a few times and a witness to how delicious authentic Thai food can be - but I still got impressed by this dish by Sweet Lime. It was well-seasoned, could taste that charred noodles and while the portion may not be as big as other places - I was still full after I finished it.

One word of advice if you decided to come here : ask for the spice rack! One of the ladies there (whom I presume is the owner) told me to try the middle jar which has the fresh watery chili sauce. It was so tasty!!! It is hot - so watch out. But OMG I loved it! It was a little sour and tasted so fresh. I even asked her to start selling it in jars to take home - COZ I WANNA BUY SOME! :D She said she's working on it but doesn't know how to make it without preservatives coz they don't put preservatives in any of their stuff. Most things are made in-house with no MSG. 

So give it a try! I'm def coming back again to bring the hubster! :D
author: Priscillia I.

description:
3 stars for hit-or-miss dishes, a bit overpriced for some basics ($3.50 for a handful of sticky rice? I was so aghast I took a photo with a banana for scale. Make your own at home!), and some tech difficulties ordering delivery online.

Dishes ordered:
- Tom Kha Soup (pretty good/standard) - $13
- Pad Kee Mao (best of the ones we ordered) - $13
- Pad Si-Ew (a little flavorless but okay) - $13
- Pra Ram Long Song (under Chef's Specials, the 2nd fav of the group) - $14
- Two orders of sticky rice (VERY small amount for the price; disappointing rip off) - $3.50 each

Eat24 didn't work so called the restaurant to order. They only use 3rd parties for delivery. Signed up for DoorDash to order; took an hour and a half. Saved $15 compared to Eat24 though.
author: Allison Y.

description: Not from the area, the aroma caught our senses from the day before. I am not a connoisseur of Thai food, but i know when something taste good. Food was delicious.
author: Lisa N.

description: Kind of overpriced for what you get. The dishes are passable, though the ingredients weren't all that fresh. I was surprised that this establishment would survive in the City with many other Thai restaurants that offer much, much more.
author: Calforever C.

description:
Really great pad Thai!!!
Definitely recommend the spicy angel wings!
The service was SO nice and pickup was very easy. 
Highly recommended to dine in or do pickup.
author: Hannah W.

description:
The food here is amazing! I've been to lots of Thai restaurants, but this one is definitely one of my favorites. The noodles are very tasty, and their calamari is perfectly done. The waiters are also very kind and accommodating.
There are also tons of gluten free options, and they leave out the peanuts and cashews if you tell them you have allergies. I highly recommend!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Never knew this place existed even though I live so close, but glad to have found a place to satisfy my Thai food cravings! My friend and I came here for lunch around 1145 and it was almost empty, but it filled up around 1215ish, despite the horrendous storm outside - seems everyone was willing to brave the wind and rain for Thai food LOL.

We ordered a pad thai with shrimp, pad kee mao with chicken, and a tom yum chicken soup appetizer for an additional $4 as part of the lunch combination special. The soup was perfect on that cold rainy day and the chicken was so tender; I just wish it had been a little bit spicier. The plates are really large and made the portions of food look tiny, but don't be deceived - there's actually a lot of noodles! Loved the sweet and savory flavor of the pad thai, except there were only 3 shrimp in the entire plate :( The pad kee mao could've been spicier too (that chili pepper on the menu is the real deceptive thing) and some of the noodles were clumped together, but the overall flavor was good. 

Service here was pretty average, nothing outstanding but nothing bad either. Parking is not easy around here but can be easily reached by multiple bus lines. Their prices are reasonable with regard to portion size and flavor too, so I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu!
author: KC W.

description:
This is based on the food I got delivered through Yelp.

Food was super late so ended up being cold, BUT everything was really tasty!

Got the Pad Thai, Crispy taro rolls and side of cucumber salad. The rolls were on the smaller side for the price but made up for it in taste.

I'll look forward to eating here fur done-in or delivery again but hopefully next time it'll be fresher and faster!
author: M L.

description: Maybe my average rating stems from coming to this restaurant with higher expectations for a 4 Star restaurant. The restaurant setting was nice and the server was attentive. The food presentation was fine. The green curry with chicken and kobocha (pumpkin) was mediocre. There wasn't a lot of flavor in the curry. The salmon stir fry dish was good (not spectacular). Dishes were $15-18 plus another $2.75 for a heart shaped  cup of white rice. For these prices, I'd expect a little bit better food and rice included. This might be good local spot for a date.
author: M L.

description:
One of the best places I tried thai food. I love pad thai in general and here I had a really good one!!! the vanilla bean ice cream was one of the most tasty things they have. I was so surprised how tasty it was. Better than many ice cream shops! I really advice this place. 
The portions are big and the price is very affordable.
author: Monika B.

description: Such good food! I had green curry with beef and papaya salad. Really attentive and friendly service as well.
author: Trace B.

description:
After waiting 45 min for Sweet Maple and still being pretty low on that list, decided to check out Sweet Lime across the street.  Can't have bacon and eggs?  Coconut curry sounds like a great alternative!

We sat ourselves since there was no hostess.  I would say there were about 6 tables in the restaurant and there wasn't an official waiter per se.  There was a man who handed us the menu's and took our order and then a woman who asked us how everything was and cleared our dishes but then went to the back and just handed us the check.

For starters we tried the fresh avocado rolls, the sauce was delicious and they were really good.  I totally ate all of them and only left 1 for my friend. 

I decided to try the coconut shrimp curry special.  

When it came out, the shrimp looked a bit like a coconut shrimp appetizer you could buy at Costco or something.  However, the actual sauce was really good.  

Overall solid 3.5 star spot and I would totally go back if I was in the area.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Delicious! Every dish was flavorful and fresh. I loved the mango salad and coconut shrimp curry. You won't be disappointed.
author: Sunshine S.

description: Mediocre Thai food that is extremely over priced. Many other great Thai spots that have better quality food for less $$
author: Jon F.

description: Did this place pay to only show good reviews? This place sucks for lunch. First of all every price online is wrong...update ur damn website. I paid 14 plus tip to pick up the smallest portion of thai food i have ever seen in my damn life..im not even lying i took a pick so u could see and it wasnt eveb the best yellow curry i ever had in my life for wanting to charge me 14 for lunch for lunch people...if u want to give out ur hard earned money for whatever ass food come here.
author: Krystal S.

description: I was very early and ate alone so getting a table was easy and it was a Monday. That said, it filled up very quickly.   I LOVE Thai food and usually get the same thing with thom kai soup and green curry.  The thom kai was spot .  I would order that again and again here.  The wine list, was a nice surprise.  They had a nice selection of quality wines- limited but it did not matter as the wines were all very good.  If you are in the area, worth a visit. Pricing was very reasonable and the staff were very attentive.
author: francesca b.

description:
Came for lunch since my brother had recommended we try this place when in town. The restaurant wasn't busy at all, only one other table....good since we didn't have to wait but should I be worried?

Our server was very friendly(forgot his name) and had great recommendations. He was descriptive and was honest about the questions we had. We ordered:

1) whole grilled squid: it had a good smoked/char taste to it and was very tender. Portion size was plenty for two. I didn't care too much for the sweet chili dipping sauce as it was good on its own with just a splash of lemon.

2) green curry w/tofu and eggplant: just the right amount of sweetness, vegetables, and tofu. My eggplant was cooked perfectly-not over cooked and mushy like most places

3) papaya salad: this was a little on the sweet side, needed more lime to it. We didn't know if they had a "spicy level scale" when ordering but we asked for this to be really spicy-9 out of 10. It came out not having any kick at all. So we sent it back and still it wasn't enough. That's okay, second time around they added more citrus so we were content. 

4) special of the day-BBQ chicken: it was moist, flavorful and just like the server said-paired really well with the papaya salad we ordered. Nice size portion. 

5) fresh watermelon juice: served with crushed ice, the perfect sweetness and sooooo refreshing.

If I lived in SF, I'd probably be a regular.
author: Tuyet N.

description: Online orders are never ready on time. Waited 45 minutes tonight when the estimate was 15-20. Second and last time this has happened.
author: Colby C.

description: Really wonderful attention to detail here, from the flowers on the nice solid wooden tables, to the beautifully crispy fried basil and the just right amount of fish sauce in the excellent papaya salad. The cooking is consistent every time, which I can't say for a lot of much fancier places. I came here on the edge of getting sick and I swear their Tom Yum soup kept me healthy. And that sticky rice with mango totally brought me back to Bali.
author: Hannah P.

description: The secret to great Thai food is the balance of flavors -sour, sweet, salty, bitter and spicy along with great natural and fresh ingredients. I was delighted to find delicious and healthy cuisine at Sweet Lime. Each dish, which I later learned were family recipes, featured delicately balanced spices, herbs and vegetables. The presentation was gorgeous with fresh flowers on the plate. A feast for the senses. My favorites were Miang Kham (ginger, jalapeno, lime, shrimp served with red leaf lettuce and tamarind sauce), Tom Yum Soup and Makhur Song Krueng (eggplant and chicken). I was warmly welcomed by manager, Thassanee Ruthaiwat (Nee) and the staff was friendly and attentive. Highly recommend Sweet Lime for casual dinner with friends or family as well as a special night out. You can also order on line and get fast delivery with one of the food delivery services in your neighborhood.
author: Patricia S.

description: Great place. Delicious food. And the best part is they can make almost everything on their menu gluten free! Really convenient when ordering in because u can mark everything for a gluten-free preparation directly from online ordering.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I can't attest for their service as I ordered online for take out. 

I can attest that the salad portions are small, specifically, the mango salad priced at $9. While the medley of flavors were great (2 small shrimps, toasted coconut, fried shallots, mint, red onion, cashews in a lime vinaigrette), I was expecting chunks of mango and not grated. Plus, it was literally a very small plate portion. This should've been listed as a starter and not as a "regular" salad. 

The chicken satay sticks were perfectly grilled and generous (4 sticks per order) and I found the Tom Yum soup to be quite authentic. I do appreciate that it wasn't as salty as other ones I've had before. 

A step up than Thai Stick nearby on Fillmore, but this place doesn't have a full bar :P
author: Janice C.

description: Very disappointed by this place.  The quantity they give is a joke.  I ordered drunken noodles and the plate was smaller than what you would get at any other Thai place and 75% was cheap vegetables.  The entree curry comes in small bowl and the amount of rice they give is laughable.  Also the staff barely speaks English. I called my server to ask a question and she couldn't understand and gave me a really loud "WHAT"? I don't understand why do they have people that can't even speak English properly taking orders.
author: Nikhil N.

description:
The best, freshest, most delicious authentic Thai food!  A charming, quiet, cozy corner restaurant, slightly off the beaten path - one block from busy Fillmore Street.  
Every meal has been memorable.  My foodie friends  ask to come here.  Am working my way through the menu, enjoying every bite.
author: Miki P.

description: A local favorite. Friendly staff, quick kitchen, and consistently good food. Takeout is ready within the estimate and can usually be seated quickly even on a Friday night. Papaya salad, fried Thai rolls, fried rice, and flat noodles dishes are my regulars.
author: Alexandra H.

description: A solid Thai place in lower pac heights. This place is one my preferred Thai stops in the city. The quality of all their dishes for the price makes this place a great value. When you walk in its a cozy place and the staff are very welcoming. My go to starter is the chicken satay, always well cooked and not too dry. The tiny side of cucumber salad that comes with it is refreshing and the peanut dipping sauce is excellent. I typically always get the pad si-ew, the flat noodles with veg and beef. The dish well seasoned, not too salty and just the right amount of sweetness. I prefer red curries but tried my friend's green curry which was surprisingly good. It was rich with flavor and subtle hint of heat from the jalapeno. The sticky rice with mango is my default dessert but tried the fired banana with coconut ice cream which was also very good. The banana is wrapped and fried which gives it a nice crunchy shell and pairs really well with the coconut ice cream. This place never disappoints and for how reasonable the prices are for their dishes, you'll gladly come back or at the very least order to take out.
author: Peter P.

description:
Just 2 blocks from our place is this Great Thai Restaurant.. Love the ambiance. Thai Decor is something I want to bring to my Home...

Ordered the Duck Spring Roll . Crisp from the outside and smooth tasty duck inside .. Get their Salmon Curry. won't regret it ..my friend ordered the Papaya Salad. Very good ..

Overall.. I'd suggest this place if your around Japan Town...

Oh Look for Aun.. His a good server .. He remembers us
author: Donovan L.

description:
I was here with my mom while we were in the area a few times. I'm finally back to write this review. This is one of my go-to's for Thai food in the area. It can get a bit pricey if you go crazy on apps, but my personal experiences here have all been great. Overall 4/5

Food: 3.5
Duck roll - A dressed up version of an egg roll. Great combination of crispy egg roll skin, crunchy enoki mushroms, savory duck, and sweet hoisin sauce.
Yellow curry - A basic sweet yellow curry with potatoes. Chicken was cooked properly (not overcooked and dry like others I've had)
Pad thai - Tasty, but nothing too special

Service: 5
Staff was very friendly and paid close attention to anything we needed; water, napkins, anything at all. 

Ambience: 3.5
For the most part it was quiet during the hours I've been (lunch and early dinner), which is nice when you're trying to have a conversation. Although once it fills up it does get pretty noisy. Maybe I'm a bit too observant, but the carpet was very worn and stained (dark splotches on dark carpet). However, the rest of the decor is nice and even has mood lighting
author: Ryan J.

description: Great dishes. Simple as that. All the curries are wonderful and the pineapple fried rice is delish! Friendly service, although our preference is the go-to take-out.
author: Lorin S.

description:
Highest quality Thai restaurant in this neighborhood! I love going for lunch by myself, since it is friendly and casual, the type of place you don't mind being on your own. 
The quality of the ingredients is very high, and the presentation, on little metal lunch trays with a side salad, is delightful.
The green curry is not overly spicy, just how I love it. The sticky rice mango has very fresh fruit and rice just the right consistency. I also recommend the fried rolls with shrimp and pork. Such a fine batter, and thin not thick like at most places - very elegant!
author: Linda B.

description: We were visiting SF and exhausted after a day of exploring. We ordered yellow curry, rice, and shrimp avocado rolls through Grubhub, delivered to our hotel. Best decision!  Easy process and delivery was relatively quick. Thai food was delicious and flavorful.
author: Sarri T.

description:
Excellent Thai Food!

The Yellow Curry was delicious, not watery, flavorful, and spiced correctly, as was the Pad Thai we ordered. 

The sweet and sour sauce that went with the Vegan egg rolls did not seem like it came from a bottle, it was made in house - another testament to the quality of food here.  Definitely the best Thai I have had delivered, highly recommend!!
author: Delilah W.

description: The Angel wings were terrible. They were soft and lacked flavor. I took them home and put them under the broiler for 15 min. To get them more crispy. It helped the texture but not the flavor.
author: Yvonne S.

description:
Good Thai food! It's a little of the pricier side for Thai like the pineapple fried rice is $16 but it's about right for the area. The place has nice service and was attentive.

Got the watermelon juice with crushed ice ($4.50). It was so refreshing! For the entrees we got the the beef pad ma khua (eggplant with basil) and shrimp pad si ew (~$11 each). Both were really good! I was disappointed that there were only 3 shrimps in the pad so ew but the flavor made up for it. It was also the perfect serving size for feeling full but not overly stuffed.
author: Linda X.

description: They are a slightly pricier than other average Thai places but totally worth it! I am extremely picky about pad thai after having gone on a trip to Thailand a few years ago, but this is definitely one of my favorite spots in the cities to go to for some excellent pad thai!!
author: Amanda A.
Claudia L.

description: The Chinese and broccoli absolutely was not worth the $16. Not even edible... waste of money
author: Ken B.

description: This is my second time ordering from this restaurant via Eat24 and will be my last. I hate leaving negative feedback, but my experience was just too disappointing. While they are quick and efficient with delivery, the food leaves a lot to be desired. I ordered the fresh rolls and paid $5 more for shrimp - and not only did they not put the shrimp in the rolls but some were even cut in half! They're likely not made to order, so why even offer the shrimp? The pad Thai was also oily and without much flavor the first time I ordered and this time I found it inedible.
author: Emily A.

description: I wanted to like Sweet Lime; it's super convenient to my apartment. The food is the definition of mediocre and they use way too much fish sauce inalienable their dishes.
author: Shannon H.

description: I've only gotten take out here once for convenience a while back, but even so I probably wouldn't come back. I always test out how good the pad thai is whenever I try a new Thai place, and the one here wasn't that satisfying and didn't taste great/fresh.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
We started with: 
- Thai crispy rolls
- Fresh roll
- Papaya salad
They were all average. Neither good nor bad, and definitely not memorable. 

Our main dishes (which took an hour to come, and came first to 2 people, then another 2 15 minutes later, and a 5th 10 minutes later), were good, but ruined by the delays. The first two people asked that our dishes be reheated, which they microwaved because the noodles congealed. 

We ordered the:
- TOFU KRA-PROW-KROB
- PAD KEE MAO 
Both of which were good. The pad kee mao needed a little extra vinegar and hot sauce, but they only had soy sauce available, which was strange. 

Don't think i'll be back, but if someone insisted I'd be ok with going.
author: Dimple B.

description:
When my sweetie and I are in the mood for Thai food we always hit up Sweet Lime. It has great good and attentive service with a welcoming atmosphere.  A nice bonus is the location on a neighborhood corner. 

My favorites things to order are the thin-sliced pork, the chicken satay, and the spring rolls.

I hear that Jeff Goldblum and his posse eat here occasionally so keep your eyes open.
author: Jay S.

description:
Good food, great company, what more can you ask for?

It's a relatively small place and great for a quiet meal but when 14 of us showed up for lunch for a team offsite, the staff were incredibly accommodating and got our meals our perfect and fast with great service all around. 

For the food, I definitely enjoyed the dishes. While I would say it's on the smaller side, the portions are very much accurately to portion sizing in Thailand (I've been to Bangkok, Chiangmai, and Pai). The food is just as authentic and my mouth is currently watering for me. 

5 of us decided on doing family style (while the rest of the table had their own dishes). We have one person who needed gluten free, 2 of us into spicy food, 1 of us who doesn't like pork and 4 of us wanting wine and myself who just wanted a cool and healthy refreshing drink. We were able to get items that satisfied us all.

I highly recommend: 
- the squid salad (very similar to the street squid I got too much of when I was in Thailand that I crave so much now!
- green curry (you can never go wrong)
- massaman curry
- and pineapple fried rice 

Also, the black iced tea with infused hint of lychee satisfied my thirst. It wasn't sweet and just perfect to what I wanted.

Give it a try! It's a local restaurant and overall delicious.
author: Leslie L.

description: Do you want to wait two hours for your food? Do you want to never get it? Do you want to call the restaurant and have them tell you that they tried calling you a bunch of times (with no missed calls) and then tell you your number with the last digit shifted one up? Then this is the place for you. A host who will try and sweet talk you until you realize that they just didn't want to fulfill your order and they don't have the gumption to really call you, will pretend to send you food. Then you can sit around and wait for it until you realize that it's been an hour since the longest time you could conceivably wait and your misplaced patience has run out. If you like that, then eat here!
author: Jason Z.

description:
Food is good overall, place is nice. Friendly atmosphere and service. Portions are pretty small for a lot of items. I'll be going here less often as the prices are getting incredibly high for thai food. Example: $14, including tax, for pad thai (that contains three shrimp) plus $5 for extra shrimp. I can't afford to eat there much right now.

Also, if they could change up their music, it would help. The same CD of some kind of elevator music, every time I go in there!
author: Tilly D.

description: We moved away from this restaurant and have missed it for about a year. Came back today and found it even better than ever. Sweet Lime is just hands down the best version of everything Thai. Save room especially for the life-changing angel wings and mango sticky rice.
author: Katrina N.

description:
We ordered takeout from here and there were some things I liked and disliked about our experience and the food. But overall, Sweet Lime is a solid option for Thai if you happen to be in the area.

Let's start off with the good. We ordered duck rolls, fresh rolls, vegetarian pineapple fried rice, and the panang curry. Taste-wise, I enjoyed everything but the panang curry was seriously outstanding. It was flavorful and rich, with that perfect blend of sweet and savory. Panang is already milder than most other Thai curries but the one here is really not spicy by my standards (and I have a pretty low tolerance for spice). So take that as you will. I'm also a fan of the fusion-y duck rolls because I love duck so much, but the fresh rolls were almost as good (and definitely a healthier option). The pineapple fried rice was also yummy and we appreciated the sweetness of the raisins complementing the fragrant spices and nutty cashews. Yum yum yum!

But now for the bad. One of our duck rolls had no duck in it! And we also didn't get any utensils or napkins with our order (not a big deal, but pretty weird and apparently we aren't the only Yelpers who experienced that). We thought the portions for the fried rice were small for the price--but I get it, it's lower Pac Heights. Surprisingly, unlike most other Thai restaurants, Sweet Lime is unable to make some of their curry dishes vegetarian or make meat substitutes (for example I like duck Penang curry but theirs is pork and no subs were allowed). 

3 stars is really too low for a restaurant that makes such delicious Penang curry but Yelp doesn't allow half stars :(
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Pretty good thai, probably some of the better I have had in the SF bay area. The sauce wasn't too sweet. The portion sizes could use some work though. We ordered an appetizer and two mains and that was just enough.

We started with the duck larb which was so different than anything I've had before. It wasn't spicy and the duck was a little fatty but I liked it. If you want spicy, you may have to ask them to spice it up.

We tried the special, prawns in red curry, and got about 6 prawns. It was really good, but it wasn't enough for two people. Then we ordered the yellow curry lamb which was AMAZING! The meat was so tender and the sauce was really flavorful.

If I am in the area I'd come back but it is a bit out of the way for me. It's also a little on the pricey side - over $20 each. I prefer to keep my meals around $15 each.
author: Jess A.

description:
I don't have much to say about this place, unfortunately.

It's way salty, portions are a lot smaller than other places, and there wasn't much depth in flavor.

I do appreciate the health conscious cooking and variety of gluten free options, though! 

It's a 2.5 for me.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Though I value those signs of Sweet Lime's health-conscious cooking -- their use of fresh vegetables, an absence of grease in their dishes, clean flavors -- our meal here was missing some excitement, some zest in the taste department. 

We ordered pad thai, crispy trout (with a sweet chili sauce similar to the one Filipinos pair with lumpia shanghai), & a dish with chicken/eggplant/jalapeño/basil/red pepper/black bean sauce. Between the runny sauces & inadequately seasoned proteins (come to think of it, the noodles were also bland), nothing made our taste buds stand at attention. 

Modest portions, yet we (two people who enjoy healthy Asian fare) managed to have leftovers. 

Our friendly server was the silver lining in an otherwise drab lunch experience.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Pretty good Thai food. Nothing remarkable from the usual Thai food you'll have but it was a clean restaurant, friendly staff, and pretty quick service. The food was fresh and tasted very good. I would definitely return if I were looking for Thai food in this area again. :-)
author: Nicholas L.

description: Amazing food and service! We even got a coupon for next time. I always try to order pick up from here to save them the cut that an uber eats takes. Would come back anytime :)
author: Greta M.

description: Really tasty, fresh, and affordable Thai food. Service was warm and friendly as well. Great neighborhood restaurant! They do not have a full bar but offer beer and wine. Many vegetarian options available.
author: Sam L.

description:
I came here on Monday during lunch.  I was in the area due to a friend having surgery at UCSF.  

We were seated quickly and the staff was very nice.

Pad si ew - 3.5 stars - I ordered the pad si ew with shrimp.  The flavor was pretty good but dish was low on the shrimp.. only 3.
Thai ice tea - 3 stars - very sweet.

This place is decent to grab a quick lunch!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
End up here on Sunday night. 

We had pad thai with shrimp. it was good but, portion was very small. 

Basil beef was chewy like rubber. They were nice enough to change our plate for something else.

We got minced chicken. Flavor was good, very small portion.

Tea us charged.

Spring rolls for appetizers are tiny and very overpriced.

Almost $50 for those 3 things. Definitely not worth it. 

Can't get over how tiny the plated were.
author: Coraline J.

description: Yum!  Excellent Thai cuisine with authentic flavors and delicious high quality ingredients.  Lots of Falang come here, but they clearly have discerning taste.  Ask and you shall receive the spiciest Nam Pla sauce you can handle, following an proprietary recipe, to add that special Umami flavor to your dish.  Prices are reasonable and the Banana Foster dessert is scrumptious.  Lots of street parking across the street after 6pm.
author: M S.

description: Ok. I usually don't review places, but the list of superlatives that have been running through my head during my dinner here deserve to be written down in a public form. The food is excellent, magnificent, and world-class. The service is exemplary, exquisite, and even outstanding. And meeting the owner and the crew was quite the treat! I will be visiting this establishment exceedingly frequently!
author: Zachary B.

description:
Really outstanding place. Many items go beyond the usual three curries and standard fried dishes. That being said, their mussamun and panang curries are worth going out of your way to sample. 

There's a sweet lime shrimp that's greatc as well. 

I recently had a dish featuring a whole roasted eggplant topped with sautéed  chicken and bay shrimp in a delicate sauce. It was lovely. 

Good desserts that go beyond the same mango and ice cream. The tapioca is a standout and their sticky rice should not be missed.
author: Tim P.

description: This was my first time here, and I really enjoyed the food and the service. I went during lunch on a weekend and the place wasn't too crowded. I ordered the pad thai, which was amazing, along with some spring rolls. The dishes can get pricey, but it is San Francisco, and considering the generous amount of food that they serve, and the friendly service, I'd say that this place is worth going. The menu also marks which dishes are gluten free, which is convenient for gluten free dining, especially since there is a lack of gluten free restaurants in Japantown.
author: Amy M.

description:
WOW IS ALL I HAVE TO SAY. This is one of those places where everyone you come with can't stop talking about how good the food is during the entire meal. We were in Japantown looking for a gluten-free place to eat and I am SOOO glad we found this place! Most items on the menu are already gluten free, and if they aren't, you can ask your server to make them specially for you. 

The chicken basil plate, the spicy angel wings, the curry salmon, and the peanut tofu were all delicious!! I would highly recommend the herb Thai rice- its twice the price of jasmine but completely worth it! 

Prime location, extremely kind servers, DELICIOUS food, and just an overall amazing experience. Definitely adding this place to my list of favorites in the city!
author: Ren S.

description: We had to kill some time, and Sweet Lime was recommended for a lunch.  It was not crowded when we arrived, so we were able to be seated immediately.  Sometimes that's not a good sign, but the meal was really delightful!  Facing a long day, I went for a simple green curry over buckwheat noodles, a lunch special.  It was really very good.  Chicken with kabocha squash and the standard peppers, onions, curry leaves, etc., in a delicious sauce.  For me it was a good amount of heat--nice, but not too much.  The noodles had a satisfying texture and taste.  Not a single complaint.  Service was warm and friendly, quick and efficient.  Well priced, great lunch!  Highly recommend Sweet Lime!
author: Kelly Y.

description:
4.5 stars. I made plans to come here on a Friday night with some friends, so I called ahead to make reservations. The lady asked me why I was making reservations because no one comes to the restaurant anyways. I got really sad... then I got happy again when I realized how good the food is! I'm glad that this place is not ridiculously crowded, but I do think they deserve more business if it really is the case that no one eats there.

I ordered Pad Thai, which is my usual entrée when trying any Thai restaurant for the first time. It was good... not greasy like many other Thai restaurants. Not an overly generous portion but just enough to be satisfied. My boyfriend ordered their Green Curry, and that was pretty good too.

Sweet Lime Thai has great service, though their waiters and waitresses could learn how to speak a little louder because I can't understand any of them and feel rude for asking them to repeat everything. My only disappointing is that they ran out of mango, so I could not order the mango sticky rice dessert, which I had been looking forward to all day. However, I would definitely come back here again and recommend to others!
author: Stefanie C.

description: This is one of the best restaurants I've been to in a long time. The pineapple friends rice is served in half a pineapple as the bowl. It's DELICIOUS! The Thai tea is very good too. All of my friends were very happy with their food as well. Prices are definitely worth it-- delicious food and good sized portions. Great food and great service! Will be back!
author: Kristen B.

description: Went for lunch on a Saturday and while all the other places had long waits, we were seated immediately here. What a hidden gem! The fresh roll was delicious as were our entrees. The fried banana dessert was the perfect size. If I'm ever in the neighborhood again I will return.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
If I still lived in San Francisco I would go here all the time, luckily I go to the Fillmore enough to visit it frequently. My husband, friend and I came here before a show at the Fillmore and after a very quick wait were seated and immediately helped. 

My husband and I ordered the mango salad, some shrimp/avocado rolls, vegan crispy rolls, and the pad kee mao with chicken. The food was excellent and left me craving a return visit ASAP. 

In addition the wait staff was so nice and friendly and we were given some fresh watermelon juice to try which was outstanding. 

I wish I could eat this right now.
author: Amber E.

description:
First time here with the parents since it was raining we just picked the first restaurant nearby. 

I don't usually write reviews but this place sucked badly and I don't understand how it's 4 stars on Yelp. 

The Tom khe soup was $14 dollars with added shrimp and it had nothing else in it besides 6 tiny shrimp and tasted terrible. 

The Mango salad was just the worst, it tasted waaaaay too strong, too sour and too salty the portion was so small with 2 pieces with shrimp for 9 dollars!!!I've never tasted a salad so horrible and when I mention to the waitress she replies saying this is their most popular salad and next time let us know after the first bait. I'm sorry but there won't be a next!!

The Jumbo shrimp was nothing but Jumbo. $19 for 6 tiny little shrimp and didn't taste that special. 

Everything else just really average for its price.

Note: 2 stars only because they took the salad off the check and it was total $107 for party of 4 after tip.
author: Steve C.

description: They clearly mark gluten free items, which is a HUGE bonus for me.  They are the best Thai I've found in this part of SF, and the best I've found period for being allergy conscious.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I love Thai food. I could probably eat Thai curry and Pad Thai everyday and not get sick of it. With that being said, I especially love this place. The food is quick and fresh, and amazingly there is usually no line to get into this place. I'm obsessed with the pineapple fried rice, Panang curry and the mango sticky rice dessert. These dishes are so good that I get them every time. We always order extra food so we can have leftovers to take home. Even the leftovers are amazing :)
author: Julie B.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Thai, but I've been here a couple times with people who are. 

My boyfriend really likes the pineapple fried rice, which I've tried and I think it's good, though the raisins in there are kind of weird to me. I've also tried the spring rolls which I actually really like (4/5).

One time I got this coconut shrimp soup which was not good (2/5). It was basically just coconut milk in a bowl with 2 pieces of shrimp. I would not get that again.

If someone really likes Thai food I would recommend this place if they were in this area.
author: Jenna G.

description: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY! Ordered delivery through eat24, what a mistake! Quoted time was 1 hour, food arrived 1 hour and 30 minutes later. No contact from the restaurant, and the food arrived lukewarm at best (everything had to be reheated). We ordered both items very spicy and only one item came spicy, the other had absolutely no spice to it. What a disappointment. Live in the neighborhood and will be taking our business elsewhere from now on.
author: Kari H.

description: This place was really good.  The food had great flavor and the presentation was A+. The Thai tea was different in taste than the normal, but very delicious.
author: Anthony C.

description: Came in during my lunch...ordered BBQ Lamb. After 5 mins, the waitress tells me they don't have lamb. The owner had her tell me this. After another minute I order BBQ Pork and steamed veggies. 5 minutes later, another waitress tells me they don't have pork! WTF! Why are they in business? All the while the freaking owner is eating and talking to a customer about how to brew tea. She should have come to me and told me what they don't have and apologized.  Not coming here again.
author: Karren B.

description: All you need to know is that they serve small portions that are extremely overpriced. The food is decent but not sure if it's worth the money.
author: Marie N.

description: Fresh squeezed limeade to start easily a 9 out of 10. All plates are family style, the wife and I ordered the shrimp PadThai and chicken yellow curry 2 staples in Thai cuisine. Shrimp Padthai is getting a 10 fresh veggies, fresh shrimp and just enough citrus. Yellow curry for me is like pizza even good when it's bad but this one was top notch easily a 8 out of 10. Customer service was good ambiance good would definitely come back any time in the area.
author: Christian C.

description:
Decent Thai food, when we first walked in for pickup we were blown away with a smell in the air. And it wasn't a good smell either, nor was it bad.. it was an.. intersting smell.. We ordered through the Eat24 app and ordered a gluten free pad thai and a pad see ew with tofu. 

1. When i say tofu, please give me tofu and not minced chicken that is hard for me to push off to the side :( (I go vegetarian on Wednesday's :P)
2. The gluten free pad thai was really god for gluten free! the noodles were thinner and it still held the pad thai flavor. 
3. If you plan on eating here, make sure to do dine-in their portions are deifnitely a lot bigger when dining in than take out.
author: Tiffany J.

description: Man, we were hungry. The delivery time was 45-60 and the food arrived after 80 minutes. I'm sure they were slammed due to the rain. The vegan spring rolls were cold--tasted like they had been fried hours ago: cardboard-like & grease soaked. The tofu & veggie tom kha soup was a can of coconut milk plus a single sprig of broccoli, one carrot sliver cut in half, five enonki mushrooms, two fried tofu pieces and some shredded cabbage. So upsetting. Not soup. Or at least, not sufficient for a vegetarian. Where my veggies at???!!! Happy to report the pad si-yew was pretty good. Not a lot of veggies but a standard amount & yummy flavor. Overall, bummer man.
author: Amber S.

description: Friendly service with unique taste- very aromatic but not the most amazing Thai food I've ever had particularly with the plethora of choices in San Francisco.  Worthwhile to checkout if you're in the neighborhood but not really a special place for a trip.  Pretty presentation with small servings
author: Ginger S.

description:
I wont be able to give the proper name for things, but it was a fine meal we had tonight in a lovely little place with attentive staff.

The highlight of the meal was the first thing we had, an appetizer on the specials board the duck rolls (now I don't know if this is type of place where the specials are pretty consistent and rarely change, or if this was truly a special. But if you see them, get them. They were sorta a cross between an egg roll and peking duck. It was $9 for three (smallish) pieces (1 roll) and not a great deal, but so good I would get them again.

Then we over-ordered the spicy green beans with chicken, the pad thai, and a spicy green curry with pork, chicken & eggplant (the eggplant was the best part, I wish they offered an all eggplant version). And we got 1 side of brown rice (which is molded into a heart, nice touch)

The bill for our feast (with a good portion of leftovers) was $53 before tip.
author: Amy W.

description: Best neighborhood Thai restaurant I've eaten in. Nee, the owner chef is extremely talented and her presentations of contemporary and traditional Thai dishes is extraordinary. It's a destination Thai food restaurant. The atmosphere and staff are delightful, and I can't go on about how nicely the food is presented and wonderful it tastes.
author: Billy M.

description: Horrible delivery service. I don't care if it's Eat24 the restaurant needs to take responsibility. Saying we're too busy in a Tuesday night at 630 is unacceptable.
author: chris n.

description: Got delivery. Food arrived on time. The food was a huge disappointment. Angel wings: so overly fried they were inedible and the sauce was way too sweet. Papaya salad: tasteless and tried to Doctor it up. Padsee noodles: mushy. Coconut chicken soup: edible. I am writing this review to remind myself never to order from this place again.
author: Jojo G.

description:
Great little thai place, I'm not sure why it's never that busy (though the one time I tried to place an order for delivery they said the wait would be 90 minutes, so I guess everyone wants to eat their thai food at home).

The food is great. The staff are super friendly. They never get impatient when it takes me a year to decide what I want to order, and the food comes promptly.

I come back to this place for more.
author: Kate H.

description: Visited for a low key weekday meal and loved this place. The atmosphere is relaxed and the food came quickly. Some of the best Thai I've had outside of Thailand. The calamari is amazing!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Great service, friendly staff, good food, and close to my house.

I'd never been here, and forgot there was a Thai place here. A friend was over and wanted Thai but did not want to walk far, and this was less than .5 miles from me. We sat immediately at an excellent table that afforded us some privacy.

The ladies there were amazing, polite, friendly, attentive. The food was great. We shared duck rolls (could eat those all night), some red snapper and some Pad Kee Mao that wasn't too spicy. After that we were pretty full so we declined dessert.
author: Jordan C.

description:
When I don't know what to eat? I go to Sweet Lime Thai. When I'm not feeling great? I go to Sweet Lime Thai. When I'm hungry? Sweet Lime Thai. 

This place is awesome. Great friendly service. Good consistent food.

I like the Fresh Rolls, curries, and well - just about everything. If you live in the neighborhood; look no further!
author: Michael K.

description:
Probably a regular occurrence, but my mom, friend and I were yet another set of victims of the Sweet Maple wait. We stepped into the relatively empty, hollister-dark Sweet Lime and decided to stay.

The mango salad was comprised of shredded, ripe (I clarify ripe because of the Vietnamese green papaya salads) mangoes in a fish sauce dressing with cashews, mint and grilled shrimp. The dressing is reminiscent of the sweet/salty clear sauce used for Vietnamese bunh (cold noodle salad with thin rice noodles, protein and pickled veg); with the mango, the overall sweetness was a bit too intense for me, and I couldn't help but wish there was some lettuce to break it up. The shrimp were grilled instead of coated in coconut and fried until GBD like I thought they would be, and though they were smoky and tender, they weren't what I wanted. This tiny pile of mango, too much dressing and two shrimp was $9, and I wasn't feeling very happy with myself for choosing this dish.

My friend picked the massaman curry, filled with beef, potatoes, pineapple, peanuts and pineapple. The pineapple was kind of random and I didn't remember seeing it on the description, though I've realized that I don't mind if pineapple shows up where it probably shouldn't. The beef was really tender and hinted that it was cooked nice and slow. The peanuts were soft, and I wished that they had been toasted and added just before serving so that they could retain some crunch. The curry was creamy and coconutty, and all three of us were spooning it onto rice sans solid fillings/toppings by the end of lunch.

The pad Thai was delicious. I haven't had a good one in a while, so maybe that's why this one was so satisfying. I thought the noodles were wrong (they seemed too skinny), but this didn't affect the flavor or texture of the dish. I liked the bits of crispy fried egg and the crunchy peanuts against the chewy noodles. The chicken was overdone, but what else is new in pad Thai land?
author: Heather F.

description:
What I love about this place besides being able to order from eat 24 is that they accommodate to food allergies. Incant have coconut and they said we won't cook your order with coconut milk and they used a different pan when cooking my food
 Even though it was an order I was able to get my food quickly and efficiently
author: Sean G.

description:
1 star for customer service. 

I forgot my glasses on the table and noticed that when I got into my car (3 mins away from the restaurant). I returned less than 5 minutes later, with the table cleared. I told them that I forgot my glasses on the table and they pretended that they never saw it there.

The give me back my signed receipt for dinner and asked me why I only tipped $3 for my own meal (which was only $11). They said that I may have made a mistake on the tip, so I gave them an extra dollar, and when giving it back, they said, "wait I think I know where your glasses are" and handed them to me.

I basically had to barter for my own glasses back. 

The food is mediocre. They put them on big plates with small portions. I don't recommend coming here and would look elsewhere for thai.
author: Regine T.

description:
The food is excellent, so on a busy night they may seem a bit understaffed. One waiter seemed kind of new. 

It's one of those places that adds the tip automatically for a large party, but it's deserving. 

The owner, Nee, is more than willing to greet the guests and make sure everything is just perfect. Can't do better than that - customer service is important. Thanks!
author: A B.

description:
Pretty great! Panang curry that you want to eat forever. Their Pad Thai, while not the very best I've ever had, is certainly really good. Convenient location, great tastes, and it was quick and easy to get a seat!

The downside: pricey (to me, anyway). Especially the Thai Iced tea...$3.50?! And, $12+ for entrees isn't exactly thrifty. 

Either way, I'll definitely be back. Nothing remarkable, but a solid nearby thai place.
author: Chris S.

description:
There are SO MANY Thai restaurants in SF. This is a good spot to visit if you're in the area and craving Thai food but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

My boyfriend and I ordered the vegetarian pineapple fried rice (it had an interesting curry flavor to it which we weren't expecting), and the vegetarian pad kee mao (it had thin vermicelli type noodles which I also did not anticipate). 

They are very thorough and polite with their service, and their restaurant is cute and clean.
author: Sarah N.

description: Dey Basic. Ordered Red Curry to go.   Came in a cardboard burger box.  Sauce and vegetables laid on tin foil....yes, TIN FOIL. WTF, where's my plastic container??? No Kap Khun Ka for you!  K Bai
author: Joe M.

description:
4 stars for food
-0.5 for portion size vs price
-0.5 for not accepting credit card under $15
-0.5 for slow service
author: Charlie Y.

description: Yummy lunch.  Very generous portions and good flavors. Food came quick and hot!  Peanut sauce was delicious.  Really like the beef rice and pad Thai.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Our go-to Thai take out and it is SO good. It's my favorite Thai in the city and yes, we are lucky to have many great Thai options in SF! I took one star off for steep prices - I'm always surprised that our 3 dish order costs us ~$50.

We order take out a few times a month from here. Standard order is:
- Green curry with chicken and squash
- pad Thai or pad see ew
- tom ka or tom yum
 
It never disappoints!
author: Simone B.

description: This place has an awesome atmosphere! They have Christmas lights up in the windows and the servers are very friendly. Their yellow lamb curry was really tasty.
author: Cappy P.

description: Ordered pick up (take out) - very quick turn around! Order was ready within 20 minutes. Dipping sauces and Chicken Pad Thai hit the spot. Spring rolls are light, sauce compliments them perfectly. Pad Thai was decent, a little dry, was missing a bit more citrus.
author: Paula N.

description: Excellent service. The food is very, very fresh. Good value, these guys are a neighborhood gem.
author: Damon B.

description:
This place is wonderful! Service was amazing. I can't say enough about the food here! 
Try the mango sticky rice dessert. It's out of this world! 
Hubby thought the sweet lime-aid was the best he's ever had!
author: Donna R.

description: This is such a cute restaurant gem that I just discovered today.  The staff are so friendly and made my lunch so pleasant.  It is very clean and cozy.  Most importantly, the food is delicious.  I'll be taking my husband and friends here.
author: L L.

description: The place just wasn't so good and the smells were odd.  The main issue was when they brought out the fried wings and calamari. The odor and yes I mean the odor of the food was just not fresh ... Disappointing and it was $100 for 2 ... Not gonna work .
author: marina g.

description: Awesome food, great service, ambiance all was terrific! I had the pad Thai, super tasty, my sister had the curry and my friend the short rib special.  All super good.  I will be back
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Great default if you can't get seating at Sweet Maple for brunch. Very personable staff and decent food. I've ordered the Pad See Ew and Panang Curry and both times they have been perfectly cook and very hot when it comes out.

I like how homey the restaurant is. I would definitely go back but its a solid thai place few blocks away from me.
author: Kunal T.

description: Still savoring this delicious meal. Seriously one of the best Thai meals I've had in or outside of Thailand. We had a special trout dish which was spicy and amazing. And a Pad Thai which was light and not too sweet. Super highly recommend.
author: Antonia T.

description: Sweet Lime is a great Thai spot with fantastic owners. I live in the neighbourhood and come here often because of the consistent experience, authentic food, and good service. A few of my favorites are the panag curry, the green curry (it's the perfect balance of sweet from the coconut milk and spicy + basil) and of course the papaya salad.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I've been here many many times now, both dine-in and takeout. My general opinion is that it's pretty good, though slightly pricey. I've tried the fresh rolls, pad thai, and pad kee mow (my usual orders). The fresh rolls here are superb; might be my favorite fresh rolls of all the Thai places I've been to in the city. They're suuuper fresh, with avocados! I wish all fresh rolls had avos! The pad thai and pad kee mow have been fairly consistently good, although I've noticed that they both have tasted better on average dine-in than takeout. For some reason (and not just because of temperature), the dishes aren't quite as good or fresh takeout. Perhaps they were made super early and were sitting around for awhile? One of the pad kee mows that I'd ordered before also ended up being slightly burnt, with a definite burnt taste to it. Bleh.. yet I still find myself going back (mostly due to its semi-later hours, closing at 10pm) so clearly I haven't been terribly offended by the food yet!

tl;dr decent Thai food. Try the fresh rolls!
author: Grace D.

description:
Fantastic service!

They use pretty high quality ingredients, which make up for the slightly above average prices and slightly smaller than average portion sizes. 

Pad Thai: Solid.

Mango Stick Rice: Honestly, probably not worth it. I love mango sticky rice and usually order it whenever I get Thai food. However, the way this restaurant does it is not your average mango sticky rice dessert dish. The rice is purple, the mango amount is minimal, and there's a flower stuck on top. Call me silly, but I prefer the regular mango/coconut milk combo over this "fancy" version.
author: Yanni L.

description:
Open late, solid food, great service, and a huge variety in the menu. Overall, Sweet Lime is a great pick for Thai in Pacific Heights. 

I've ordered takeout a number of times and always been pleased. I love that they offer fresh rolls with just veggies, mint, and avocado that aren't fried or tofu-filled; it's a great healthy option, as I eat vegan for part of the week. The yellow curry is rich and mild, but you can ask for it spicier. My boyfriend ordered the whole fried fish with sweet and spicy tamarind/chili sauce and picked all the meat off the bones and said it was good; it's truly a whole fish, face, fins, and all. 

Lastly, I love that they up the romance with the low lighting, candles, and white lights on the trees out front. It's a great place for a date or intimate meal, especially on cold/rainy nights.
author: Laura J.

description: The best Thai Food restraunt in the City! Fresh ingredients with a variety of traditional Thai dishes offered as specials. Flavorful combinations.  Great wine selection. The atmosphere is cozy local neighborhood restraunt. Wonderful friendly service.
author: Allan B.

description:
Perfect little neighborhood Thai place.
Quiet, small, chill, inexpensive, are some of the words that come to mind. The food is tasty (highly recommend the fresh rolls - want to bathe in that delicious sauce) and the service is generally very good.
author: Caroline B.

description:
We were driving along Geary Blvd past 9 pm looking for a place to eat and most of the restaurants that we drove by were already closed or were closing. We yelped for restaurants around the area and sweet lime thai came up! 

Parking was a little difficult to find but we were lucky to snag a spot 2 blocks away. When we got there,we were seated right away since there were only 2 tables that were occupied. Service was okay- food came out fast but servers could be a little bit more friendly. Food was great but compared to other Thai restaurants I've been to, their portions were a bit smaller. You should try their beef panang!
author: Jade P.

description: SO GOOD! Came here because one of my friends was trying to eat gluten free and this place popped up on yelp. Most of the menu is gluten free by default and you can ask for everything else gluten free. I will definitely be coming back. Everything we had was delicious!!!
author: Christine A.

description: Loved this place. Super friendly staff, no waiting time, good food. Had the green curry with shrimp - wonderful. The most impressive food though was the desert - banana wrapped in a thai wrap, with caramel sauce and ice cream. Was truly amazing! I'm a super fan of places where you can get good food without dealing with some hosting with bad attitude, so this is my style. Really liked my experience here.
author: Marilia S.

description:
Go-to Thai place for quick service and decent ambiance. 

New favorite dish here is the green curry with chicken - so yummy!
author: Amelia C.

description: Management here took over several years ago for a long-established family Thai restaurant. I have always liked the Sweet Lime food, the service is fine and the atmosphere is cozy and quiet to allow for conversation. So, all good. My issue is with the prices, which keep escalating. I've noticed that it's a concern that keeps popping up in customer reviews of this restaurant. When I go to a Thai restaurant, I like to have an appetizer or soup, an entree, rice, a beer, and maybe dessert. And to feel I've had an affordable meal. Sweet Lime makes that difficult for anyone of moderate means. The appetizers and soups are as expensive as the main dishes, which is obviously unusual. Two diners would be lucky to get out of this place for $70. That's for small portions (another frequent customer complaint) of Thai food. With regret, I've had to drop Sweet Lime from my list of neighborhood favorites.
author: John C.

description: Definitely not meeting my expectations for restaurants in SF. Pad Se-ew is too plain. Definitely not recommended...
author: Yuhuan T.

description: I dined here with a group of friends and we found the food excellent and the waiter very attentive. We had a crab roll special that was really good and one of the desserts was a salty/sweet mango dish surrounding mung bean salad. We'll definitely be back.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Wow -- I couldn't have picked a better place to have dinner!

Shockingly I've never had Thai food before,  however, I figured that the time to try it is now. I ordered the Pad Thai (with shrimp and chicken, wanted the best of both worlds) and it was delicious. Very fresh tasting. My mom got a pineapple rice dish, which was also great. The presentation of food was above and beyond and the portions are very generous!

We also got some fresh rolls to start out with, too. I highly recommend them, they were some of the best I have ever had.

Very clean restaurant, affordable, stellar service (the two ladies working tonight were very helpful and so sweet!), and an extremely clean kitchen! The ambiance is nice too, I enjoyed the jazz/big band music playing in the background. Also, Sweet Lime is in a nice location and there is a Muni bus stop across the way. The restaurant itself is right across the street from Sweet Maple... I wonder if Sweet Lime and Sweet Maple are owned by the same people?

Next time I am in town, I will come again. However, I'm forever spoiled when it comes to Thai food now because my expectations for any Thai spot where I live will be extremely high due to my wonderful dinner tonight! Thank you for a wonderful experience!
author: Danielle M.

description: A regular here for lunch since I work close by. Everything is pretty good! I especially love their pad thai, all the curry dishes, pad kee mao. Only sucky thing is when I ordered shrimp pad thai and literally got 2 pieces of shrimp for $2 extra -_-! Therefore no longer get shrimp pad thai. Overall, great place for thai tho!
author: Crisgel B.

description: This has been one of my favorite spots since I happened upon it. Being a celiac they have a great GF menu with a wide selection. I always leave full and happy! Good food, good service, and Gluten free what more could you ask for!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Oh my god. The pad si-ew is one of the most delicious noodle dishes I've ever had. After years of eating Chinese chow fun, I've feel like I've been enlightened by the Thai way of cooking these flat noodles. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.
author: Teresa I.

description: Great food and great service. The yellow curry w tofu was great, and the mango sticky rice was particularly fabulous. Also loved the Ginger Lemongrass Tea!
author: Gregg A. J.

description: $8 plates for $12. Ordered a pork dish that was all vegetables except for six tiny pieces of pork. There are far too many solid Thai restaurants in the city. Don't waste your time or money here.
author: Sean K.

description: Was blown away with the quality of the food, especially the drunken noodles and the green curry with extra spice
author: Sandhya S.

description: Pad Kee Mao and Angel Wings for lunch. The chicken wings were delicious. Even though I had to walk home and I forgot to ask them to put the sweet chili sauce on the side, it was still crispy and good by the time I got home. Pad Kee Mao was good, but a little salty for my taste. About $20 for these two dishes during lunch time.
author: Chris K.

description: I don't go here anymore. Every dish tastes like it has tons of fish sauce in it. I mean really, really fish-saucy. Ordered  a salad & asked if the dressing had fish sauce. They said it did but they would leave it out. When I tasted it all I could taste was fish sauce. They swore there was none in the dressing, then they changed their story & said they couldn't leave it out--of SALAD DRESSING! Then they said they could give me a different dressing. Okay, why didn't you tell me that in the first place? Just don't lie to me. Not a good place for vegetarians.
author: Wan T.

description:
We were looking for somewhere to eat late Saturday night with not much of wait, and this place was open. The food was just okay but the service was pretty good.

The food just seemed to lack a lot of flavor. What I've come to know, and frankly why I love, Thai food, is the strong, pungent flavors each dish has. Whether is be a curry dish, soup, or even a salad. The food seemed to go half-speed on the flavor levels. Not really too sure what was going on. I wanted to like this place since the reviews seemed great and there was no wait, especially in area of downtown where most restaurants are full on a Saturday night but the food was just not up to par. Even the portions were quite small from what I expected.

The service was just okay. It's what I expect it to be in an Asian restaurant. Polite and prompt to a point but not much else. 

I don't think I'll be back here anytime soon, unless I had to. I have other favorites in the San Francisco area if push comes to shove.
author: Nate C.

description: Awesome stirfry vegetables and tofu! Rice is delicious! Very clean and healthy! Pair with Jasmine Green Tea! Enjoy!
author: Nataly P.

description:
Great experience and will definitely be getting takeout from them again!

Ordered the fresh rolls, which were fresh and delicious, as well as the pad see ew with shrimp. The pad see ew was well seasoned and had lots of veggies. Would probably pass on the shrimp in the future (normally just order with chicken).

Fast takeout, under 45 minutes on a Saturday night. A little pricy for $$, but with a $20 delivery minimum ended up being the perfect amount of food for 1.
author: Caitlin O.

description: Excellent food! Not particularly cheap though decent value for money given its SF (lunch special w appetizer plus a drink came to $25 w tip). Low key casual atmosphere, no music though so a bit sterile. Friendly staff. Will come back for sure.
author: coolidgedecides o.

description: I recently started eating gluten free and I have high standards for Thai food. This place had great gluten free food. My girlfriend and I got the Pad Thai and green curry with chicken and squash. They were both great. The portions were sizable with enough for us to both have seconds and leftovers. The green curry has jalapeños and is delicious. You couldn't even tell they were gluten free. I'd eat it again!
author: Daniel C.

description: Pricier than most Thai places I go to in the city, but it's worth the splurge. Service and presentation is top notch. This is the first time I've been anywhere that plates their rice in the shape of a heart! (See pic.) Their curries are some of the best I've tasted. My favorite is the green curry because I love it spicy - I like that there are various meat choices including duck and their wine selection and desserts are also stellar.
