I highly recommend dining here if you want an authentic taste explosion
author: Elaine W.

description:
Way overpriced. Food was mediocre. Server was pushy. Don't get hussled by the "specials."

Way overpriced. Food was mediocre. Server was pushy.

Way overpriced. Food was mediocre. Server was pushy.
author: Jo E.

description:
Sweet Lime Thai is not the best "traditional" style Thai, but it is good. They have many vegetarian, gluten free and vegan options. 

Gluten free notes: They have a separate gluten free menu, however for some reason it is not on their website. The GF pad see ew was wonderful! I am sensitive to cross contamination, it did not happen here (but I unfortunately cant make guarantees for future visits).
author: Shannon Z.

description: Lackluster is what comes to mind when we tried our food from here. It was pricey for Thai food and our expectations were higher because of the ratings and the price and area it was in! However, the salad, soup, chicken satay, and pad see ew was bland, underseasoned, and were served in sad, small portions.
author: Annie D.

description: This place just misses the mark. Food is not fresh and for what we ordered it's not worth it.  Such a disappointment.  Ordered the chinese broccoli with crispy pork and it was soft pork belly. Nothing was crispy.  Pad si ew was flavorless and we asked for spicy, it was bland.  Service was rushed.
author: Laura G.

description:
Delicious!  I ordered the Pad Sew Ew and the tofu Fried rice.  Both were amazing!

Just ordered the wonton soup.  Super bland, wonton fillings have no flavor and is dense, needs Napa cabbage or a veg in the filling to lighten it up.  There's also BBQ pork, a lot of it, and it makes the broth sweet, losing the savory essence of wonton soup.  Would not order this again.
author: Hampton E.

description:
Terrible.

Pork Curry was horrendous.  They used cubes of pork that is usually used for Chinese soups (i.e. tastely blocks of protein).  Dude, use pork neck, pork loin, I dunno, get some real meat that has taste, not some cubes of meat that fill up your tupperware.

Wrong order as well.  Gave me a cheaper appetizer.  Oh yeah, coz they called me and asked if I needed rice, 3 times, and I kept saying I will make my own rice.  Which part of it do you not understand?

$3-$5 doesn't justify losing a customer.  Think long term.
author: Koalie W.

description:
My go to Thai place. I've gotten takeout from here at least 20x in the last year. (Think about it: that's once every other week practically. I know, crazy.)

I almost always get the Veggie Pad Kee Mao with Tofu. Other things are good too, but their Pad Kee Mao is the best I've ever had -- and I've tried the noodle dish at many, many Thai restaurants.

I *think* the waiters know my face/name by now. At least I can flatter myself with the thought -- I'm finally a regular somewhere!
author: Aditi J.

description:
I really had higher hopes for this Thai food spot since there are only two nearby in the neighborhood but I always feel that the flavors aren't very fresh and the fried foods are soggy. I'm not sure when they prepare the food but that's the main problem. Id say the same goes for the noodles,
Pad Thai seems like it's been sitting in some storage area for way too long.
author: Kaego R.

description: The food here was great.  Easily one of the better Thai restaurants in the city with reasonable prices, however service was a little bit lackluster.  Good option if you're around Japantown and  Thai.
author: A B.

description: The meat was scarce, over cooked and had barely any flavor. Not worth the money, when there are better places to eat!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Sweet Lime Thai was recommended by a serious foodie friend and I tried it last night. So delicious! I took the suggestions of the person on the phone (very helpful, patient and gracious) and ordered the Yellow Curry with Chicken, the spring rolls (cold ones) and sticky rice. Nothing adventurous but it was seriously good. My husband, who isn't a Thai food fan, lapped it up. The delivery arrived in the short time of the span that was 35-50 minutes. I will definitely order again and look forward to trying all of the dishes that nice person recommended...and more!
author: Susan L.

description:
I eat lunch here all the time - sometimes dine in and mostly to go. 
I love their curries and always ask for it spicy. 
I also really enjoy the Kao Rad Kra Prow - just simple delicious and fresh. 
Looking forward to sampling the rest of the menu.
author: Christine V.

description:
I come here often for lunch and have tried a handful of their noodle dishes on their menu. This is nice restaurant to dine at especially if you are on your own as well. THe taste of the food is consistent as well, however the portions seems to be different each time I come. 

The most recent visit I came with a big party. I ordered a pad-siew and the portion was ridiculously small. It wouldn't even be enough for a middle-schooler to eat and that was really disappointing. They also seem like they cannot handle large parties. Our food took a long time to come, I guess they might own have 1 cook? 

I hope next time I come the portion will be better.
author: Lucy C.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and Sweet Lime Thai is my go-to spot for Thai food whenever the mood strikes. I've never had trouble getting a table and I order take-out quite often too.

I haven't had anything I didn't like here. I usually stick to my tried and true favorites when it comes to Thai food, and Sweet Lime Thai has definitely gotten the basics down.

Delicious things:
- green curry (actually, all their curries)
- pad see ew (actually, all of their pan fried noodles)
- vegan crispy roll
- pad prik khing with tofu (green beans and tofu in spicy red sauce. can't be healthy but who eats thai food to be healthy?)

Fair prices and delicious food. No complaints here!
author: Amanda C.

description: Slow delivery; food was not worth the wait. Had the Sweet Lime Suki and the meat was dry, vegetables were withered and I didn't love the sauce. My wife got Pra Ram and the sauce was grainy and tasted too much like fish sauce. Promised delivery time was 30 - 60 minutes, but they took over 90. All that and they cost 15 - 20% more than similar restaurants with better food.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Came here for take out order. I felt little pricey for noodles. Girls were very friendly but they were talking in Thai all the time so made me feel uncomfortable while waiting for my food. Food was okay but too much soy sauce. I will come back for dinner let's c how that will go
author: Aj K.

description:
Love the food. 
My favorites are there Tom Yum soup and Tom Kha soup.
Along with the special preparation of the whole fish in a sweet sauce (Pla Saam Rod). 
They also prepare their fish of the day (usually Tilapias) in the similar preparation, which is slightly pricier and is little complicated / messy to be eaten with all the bones and stuff....

I also love their curries (Red, Green, Panang...)

Overall : A big ThumbsUP!
author: Parul V.

description:
Wow.  Let me start by being honest about the weaknesses of this place--they delivered the wrong food initially, so it did take longer than it should have to get my food (about one hour and 15 mins).  And they didn't think to offer silverware to someone staying at a hotel, so that was a little fun to navigate.  

But honestly, this was wonderful food, and they resolved the order mistake in under 15 minutes.  I had the fresh rolls, which were tasty and fresh with an excellent dipping sauce.  Best of all was the Tofu Kra-Prow-Krob Salad, which was to die for--excellent consistency and fry technique on the tofu, great flavors, and wonderful to have the crispy basil and cashews for their crunch.  

They'd have gotten five stars from me had it not been for the delivery problems and lack of silverware.  I'll definitely order from them again--though I'll check my order before the delivery guy walks away and should apparently request silverware!
author: Jennifer D K.

description: It's fine. Not the best in the city, but it's ok. Best part is the awesome bar. But sadly it closes very early. What a waste of a good liquer license.
author: Jason H.

description: Highly recommend! The Pad Thai's presentation was out of this world. I'd say the only thing that was lacking was flavor in the meat of the dish (chicken in my case)- it was slightly bland.
author: Tejas M.

description: Pad Kee Mao was amazing! We also got the red curry, which didn't stand out too much for us. But, we popped in at like 9:45pm (15 min before closing), and they happily took us in! Really great, friendly service throughout the meal - a little on the pricier side I thought, but would still definitely be back :)
author: Sam U.

description: Great thai food. We ordered the green curry with chicken which was excellent and spicy.  We also ordered the eggplant and tofu dish which was alright (very salty).  even though the eggplant dish wasnt on point, the overall atmosphere, price, presentation and quality of the food was great.  will definitely be back.
author: Yasi N.

description: Very unfriendly and forgetful service. Was charged $5 for a side of peanut sauce that was disgusting when all I wanted to do was try it. Very small portion size that left me hungry after an $18 meal. Food was good but I definitely won't be coming back which is sad because I just moved in next door.
author: S M.

description: All food was great. Iced tea was amazing, and I dislike tea. Lamb curry and fried rice dish were best I've had. Dessert was great too.
author: John P.

description:
Grabbed a late dinner here a few nights ago with my wife and a friend. I adore Thai cuisine and having just moved to the city, I was excited to see what it had to offer. Unfortunately, by the time we were ready to eat, it was the wrong side of 9:00 pm and Sweet Lime was the only place open. We got there about 45 minutes before closing and ordered.

We got the Fresh Roll as an appetizer. It was delicious. I would definitely recommend it.

I ordered a green curry with chicken and squash as my main course. The curry was tasty but lacking a bit of spice and smell. Part of that is my fault for not asking for more spice. It's not the best green curry I've had but it was pretty good.

My wife ordered the Pad Nam Prik Pow with Squid. I had just a couple of bites and it was quite good. I'm not a big squid fan, though. She enjoyed it a lot, which can be attested to by the fact that there were no leftovers!

We skipped dessert.

Overall, it was a nice, affordable place just a couple of minute's walk from where we're staying. We'll definitely be back in the next few weeks.
author: Sohum M.

description: I went there weekly when I lived nearby and loved their food.  A great restaurant!
author: John B.

description:
Im a bit bummed out about this place, seeing good reviews and stars attracted me to this place.our server was horrible, had a bitchy attitude and constantly forgot about our orders. For example: ordered steamed rice, brought it to us after 25mins. 
Another thing that upset me was that i ordered their famous "warermelon juice". When the server made it in the blender she filled up glass then put the left overs in a mug and took it to a table, then came back to the bar to pick up my glass and finally gave it me. Its so obvious that they focus more on their regulars/locals.
I do not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Miggs S.

description:
Living in NOPA have been looking for a good Thai delivery place and this is the third place I've tried and is the best this far. 
Having been to Thailand several time I like Thai food closer to how the natives eat, so naturally I'm skeptical and try the basics like green curry and pad Thai to compare before venturing into the other menu items. 
The Thai curry was more creamier than I like, but stroll full of flavor and not overdone with spices. The pad Thai was decent not too sweet as you generally find and cooked to a good firmness, not too soggy. 
Overall not bad and will be trying it again with other menu items.
author: Harshal V.

description: The food was good but I'm docking them for the wine they served me. I ordered a glass of red wine that they served me from a bottle that was opened the prior day. It tastes like red wine that had been left out open overnight. I think that was unacceptable.
author: S M.

description: Beware vegetarians and vegans. They use fish sauce and chicken broth in their sauces and soups. not friendly
author: EatVegetarian F.

description: My god! This place! This place gives me life! YAS! The sticky rice? Redic delicious and made with black rice which for some reason makes it even tastier!  The special which is that deep friend trout in spicy red sauce - this is really spicy but worth the mouth pain, so very addictive.
author: Shelley R.

description:
Positives-
-Kind staff
-Delicious, interesting cuisine 

Negatives-
-Black hair in my curry puffs
-delivery guy appeared loathe to the idea of delivering to hospital.
author: Emily K.

description:
This is a lovely restaurant with a wide open room and plenty of windows. 

But if you show up by yourself you likely won't be seated in one of the spacious tables by the windows, which will be held in reserve for diners who inexplicably won't show up no matter how many times you come and sit alone in one of the tables by the wall, under the houseplants, out of sight from the waitstaff. 

This is the kind of place where the waitress might dispute your menu selection and tell you why it's the wrong thing to order. You'll admit that the food you finally get is pretty good, served in beautiful large dishes which almost manage to disguise the fact that you're not getting a lot of food -- but not quite. The prices almost seem reasonable, until you cast your mind back to the beautiful large plates that almost disguised the fact that the amount of food you were served was really rather small -- but didn't quite.

You'll leave the restaurant thinking that this would be a solid five star restaurant if you had a low opinion of yourself. But you don't, and for just a brief second you may feel indignation. But who are you kidding, really? You know you'll be back because the food is pretty good and there isn't another decent Thai restaurant nearby.
author: Horace A.

description: a surprise found as there are too many people in sweet maple... the kid can not stand the loudness in sweet maple either. this one across the street is a better choice for lunch if u like spicy thai food and need a quite place to talk.
author: Andy W.

description: I highly recommend the fresh roll, BBQ lamb, avocado salad, mixed green salad, saam kasat, kabosha squash, and whole fish special. Everything is very fresh and made from scratch at Sweet Lime. They have delivery too. It is better to call them directly than to order from applications like GrubHub and Eat24. These applications make their money by taking a large portion of any profit from the restaurant.
author: Christopher B.

description: I just walked in with low expectations and food ended up being extremely tasteful and fresh! The menu has meat and seafood but it's so vegan-gluten-free friendly. Service couldn't be better with two lovely people
author: Camila F.

description:
I just moved in across the street, and was excited to try a thai place that would be convenient.

From reading previous reviews, I noticed people complained of small portions, so my boyfriend and I ordered a few dishes. I didn't notice yelpers complain about the food having zero flavor!

We got the Tom Ka Gai... meh,  tasted like they dumped some coconut milk in chicken broth, threw in mushrooms and lemongrass and wrapped it up; pretty sad. 

I got the sweet chicken wings. I liked them, they were tangy and hot, but over-fried. Flavorful, but they were pretty small.

I got the pad thai, which was a sad display of squished, gummy noodles with a lack of sauce and crumbled peanuts. the shrimp on top were not de-veined (YUCK)

My boyfriend got the egg plant noodle dish with chicken. BLAND, with soggy vegetables.

Overall, really disappointing. Still hunting for a thai spot in the neighborhood :(
author: Natalie W.

description: Ordered take out. Yellow curry chicken with eggplant. Super yummy but I wish they had put my lunch dish in more of a container!
author: Priya S.

description: I live near-by so I have used Sweet Lime many times for takeout food. I love Thai Food more than anything so it's hard for me to ever have it and not find it amazing. With that said, their red curry dish is so out of this world that I had to Yelp! about it. I mean, really- it's incredible. I now order it every single time I get takeout.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
You know when you were young and your mom used to ask, "So, what did you learn in school today?"  And your response was always, "Nothing."

Today I did learn something.  I learned that Rad Nah apparently is overcooked, bland, greasy noodles and chicken sitting in a bowl of bland, greasy gravy.  I can't actually even call it gravy.  It's just bland greasy grease.

I also learned that even soy sauce can't help a dish sometimes.  Oh, and that the restaurant has a $15 credit card minimum policy that we didn't see anywhere, so one of us had to pay since the lunch specials were only $8/person.

See Mom, I learned three things today!
author: Tori S.

description:
Tasty and flavorful with great service and beautiful, thoughtfully presented dishes.

Sweet Lime Thai Cuisine has created a warm, nicely lit, nicely decorated environment, with good, polite, prompt service, and tasty Thai dishes that will absolutely satisfy your craving.  

The CHICKEN PAD THAI was beyond delicious...it was, in fact, addictive!!  I could've eaten it all day and night!!!  The flavors were just much more vibrant than the average pad thai I've experienced! ($9)

The LAMB YELLOW CURRY ($14) was also delicious, although a little spicy for my taste buds...but I'm a super-lightweight in the spice department!  The flavors were very good, though, well-developed, and the lamb wasn't overcooked or chewy, the way it sometimes can be in a curry or stew.

The only thing I didn't dig was the PORK KAO PAD ($9), which is essentially fried rice.  It wasn't bad persay, just decidedly bland.  Sometimes people assume that fried rice is a bland dish, but actually, I think that when it's done well, it is actually very flavorful...sadly, that was not the case here.  In fact, I was so disinterested in it, I didn't even take home the leftovers, which is not generally like me!

It should be noted that you can get regular jasmine rice or brown rice, so if you're trying to stick to the super-healthy thing, they've got your back!  Also, the food presentations are beautiful:  even your rice comes in the shape of a heart!  The salads my friends got were drop-dead gorgeous, and reportedly quite scrumptuous, too, although I didn't try them personally.

I will definitely be back here!
author: Amy L.

description:
Fresh and absolutely delicious. Had fresh spring rolls and curry puffs tonight with a glass of Malbec. Perfect! 

Another favorite is yellow lamb curry. Melt I'm your mouth .... YUM!

Pad Thai is great!

Tuesday eves ... Bottles of wine are 1/2 price.

Check it out.
author: Irja C.

description:
Stumbled this place after walking around Japan Town after a few hours of shopping.

For a Sunday around 6:00pm it wasn't very busy. There were only about 5 tables filled. The waiter was really nice and we were seated right as we walked in. 

My friends and I ordered the pineapple fried rice, pad thai, yellow curry and pad see ew. 

Overall the food was great, not too salty everything was perfectly seasoned. The portions are bit on the small side except for the pineapple fried rice (it was served in the pineapple). Most places cut the pineapple in half but this place just a sliver was cut off so there was plenty of rice for 5. 

First place where I had the pad see ew and it didn't taste burnt. It had that wok taste and it was delicious! 

Another plus is the bathroom is VERY clean!
author: Kim L.

description: We've been here three times now, and we have yet to try a dish that wasn't delicious. The delicious things we've tried include Calamari Rings (hot and sweet), Vegan Crispy Rolls (very crispy), Soft Shell Crab (luscious), the Choo Chee Salmon, Coconut Shrimp (yum!), and the Green Curry with Shrimp & String Beans (perfect). The service is super friendly and prompt. The prices are a good bit higher than you'd expect at a Thai restaurant, but the food is delicious.
author: David K.

description: Samm Kasat was amazing! The watermelon juice special was great. I'd pass on the satay just because there are so many better explatory options, but wow! And not packed for lunch at all.
author: Courtney M.

description: Came here at 6 on a Sunday. They were able to accommodate our party of 10 very quickly. Our food came out promptly and service was friendly. My favorite was the lamb curry! :9 The meat was delicious and tender, and the coconut milk was creamy and a great complement to the veggies, rice, and lamb. We will be back!
author: Henna P.

description: Mediocre at best. All their dishes taste like desert...sweet fried rice, sweet green curry, sweet squid salad (with way too much fish sauce). I guess they are living up to their name Sweet Lime.
author: Reed H.

description:
Great atmosphere, delicious food, and outstanding staff. I'll definitely be returning soon. 

The lamb curry was flavorful and beautifully presented. Same with the fried banana and coconut ice cream dessert - whoa. 

The staff were friendly and hilarious. If you're interested in planning an adventure in Thailand, ask the staff for recommendations. We took lots of notes.
author: Jay S.

description:
The starter was duck larb and in contrast with the many other larb dishes I have had, it was salty and slightly gritty with a few limp cilantro leaves. It had a peculiar flavor and texture that was reminiscent of what I might imagine Comet to taste like if it were served to humans. 

          The coconut shrimp which was the special and it was clearly an attempt to clear the fridge of substandard ingredients. It was flavorless and had a very minute serving of delicious green curry.  We politely asked for some more of the delicious green curry and we were offered a side order for $4. This was the most delicious part of our meal and it was spoiled by the unflapping portion size control  that could only belong to a tightfisted  boss with no desire to please customers. 

           At the end we were honest and they offered sorbet which was a nice gesture but after paying so much and feeling so dissatisfied, it was an overall disappointing experience. For 60 dollars we could have made a delicious home cooked meal. 

           Thank you, Sweet Lime, for reminding me how much more satisfying a home cooked meal can be.
author: Jimi G.

description: Definitely the best Thai food in the Alamo square area. I really love their yellow curry with brown rice. The pad Thai and pad see ew are as good as you would hope for them to be as well. I typically order to go but I also like to eat in occasionally and they are super friendly and quick. Highly recommended the tom ka soup.
author: Annie R.

description:
We ordered for 2 and it costed north of $70, yet the food was nowhere near the cost or the 4 stars on Yelp. I'm not a picky eater but the food was mediocre at best, maybe I expected too much for a 4 Yelp star and expensive place.
The only good part was the ontime and nice deluvery guy.
There are a lot more better Thai restaurants in the same area.
author: Billy L.

description: Decent thai food, a little over-priced.  Tried a few dishes and was not really wowed by any of them.
author: Paul W.

description: Decided on some Thai and ordered the Pad Nam Prick Pow and it was great! Ordered it to go and the food was ready really quickly. Everything was cooked just right and the staff was really friendly. Would definitely try some other dishes! Highly recommended!
author: Farmer T.

description:
excellent neighborhood favorite. best Thai restaurant in town.

that's really all there is to say. but yelp wants to call it a tip unless I add some more words in here. so obviously you can stop anytime without fear of missing something. 

so, like, did you hear this one?
snowman walks into a bar,
    sniffs
        and says
"Hey, this place smell like carrots too"
author: Steve F.

description: There were multiple errors in our takeout orders. The avocado salad was subpar and the shrimp was rather nonexistent. The Thai Ice teas were only halfway filled! And the green curry had extra eggplant rather than none per order request. Not impressed, sorry but there's better thai restaurants in the city.
author: Colton R.

description:
Food is good! Nice place too. But I usually get better services than tonight when I went by myself. First they were about to seat me when I walk in but then they saw two ppl walking in, so they let them sit at the table first and told me to wait for another one was about to leave. It was ok since that table is big. After 5-10 min wait, another group of three ppl walk in. So a lady came up and told them would give them the table I was waiting. I was shocked. And then her colleagues told her I was waiting for that table. So she pull out a little table right next to the entrance and told me to sit there. When I told her I was waiting for the other table. She said" this is the only table available because you are only one person.

First, why didn't they pull out that table earlier if that's the only table for one person.
Second, that was the second time they see more ppl more money, so they make me wait or sit me somewhere else. In this case, I don't think they want my business because I'm only by myself.
The last major thing is she didn't even try to talk nice or apologize or even trying to be nice about it, but giving me an attitude.

Not a good way to end my day after a long day work
author: wing c.

description:
People watching - a few things I saw:
A couple doing the "rub your tummy & pat your head" thing.
G dudes and their FH talking about lots of yoga helping digestion.
A big Japanese group chatting boisterously the whole time.

Minuses:
It's called "Lime", but there's no Corona.
Paper covers the tables but BYO drawing instruments.
Price versus serving size, sometimes.

Had I known my appetizer would be about double the food for about half the price of my entree, I could've just gone tapas all the way. But who am I kidding? I needed to try that BBQ lamb from the $unlabeled specials chalkboard. Seriously, it wasn't much food, which might be why the meal didn't really click for me till I re-browsed the menu and threw the grilled whole squid into the mix. They also have a veg optional version of the Missy Elliott "still shave my cho cha" salmon.

One of the waiters resembled a younger version of my older brother. They're nice overall. If I return, I'm going to explore the curry selection.
author: Dan B.

description: Very mediocre and not as flavorful as expected for Thai food. I wanted to love it because it is by my home but was disappointed especially for the price.
author: Snow B.

description:
Pros:
- makhur song kreung (whole eggplant) was really good!
- fish (I think salmon) was tender, flaky, and buttery
- eggplant chicken was tasty too-- soft eggplant and juicy chicken

Cons:
- dishes aren't too large, so you will probably need to order 1 or 2 more than the number of people in your group

Bottom line: really good Thai food. I wouldn't mind visiting again, but I'm not a huge fan of Thai food, so I don't know if I'll ever be back.
author: Jiann M.

description: Genuine thai food for a good price. Pad thai with tofu is our favorite! Super friendly staff as well!
author: Jonas L.

description: The food tasted ok. However, I got sick a few hours after eating here. Coincidence? I don't know...
author: Lori T.

description:
The best Thai I've ever had. 
They also are great with gluten issue people!!
author: Keith Z.

description:
5 stars for service
31/2 stars for food. 
Standard Thai that will do the trick if your in the mood, but nothing exceptional. 

Green curry shrimp with green beans was hearty and satisfying. The shrimp were incredibly tender and succulent. 

Tom Yum was really basic- shrimp, mushrooms and a couple tomato slices floating in a lot of broth.  Again the shrimp were succulent but there was no apparent galanga, lemongrass or kaffir leaf as stated on the menu...
author: Ella M.

description: Love this restaurant. Always dependable for great Thai food with a fairly quick delivery (I live in lower Pac Heights). Have only ever ordered to go, so can't review the restaurant itself, but the food is solid!
author: Lauren C.

description: I found out about Sweet Lime Thai when I was looking into Thai places that deliver in Lower Pac Heights. Their dishes are fresh (not greasy at all!) and have bold, authentic Thai flavors. Some of my favorites are the Red Curry, Duck Rolls, Mango Salad with Shrimp and the Chicken Thai Herbs Fried Rice. So glad I found this place because it is now one of my favorite Thai restaurants in SF.
author: Nikitha R.

description:
Wow!

I wish I could eat here all the time. Everything on the menu is pretty much delish!
No lie. Authentic Thai family with great recipes running this spot!
author: C M.

description: Delicious and excellent warm service, prompt and heart shaped rice (cute). I enjoyed the yellow curry and spring rolls were not too fried. Yum.
author: Tim D.

description: Some of the best Thai food I've ever had, hands down. The yellow curry is amazing and they gave a hearty serving of veggies with the dishes we ordered. One minor complaint i have is that their peanut sauce is a little on the bland side. I like my peanut sauce with tons of peanut flavor and spice. Regardless, this restaurant is worth a try.
author: Fletcher K.

description:
My Vision: A quick sit down meal of some delicious, yet inexpensive shrimp pad thai off the lunch menu.

Sweet Limes vision: Mushy, sweet noodles, hard tofu, and 2 very overcooked shrimp for $11.42

Me: excuse me, I ordered shrimp pad thai, there's only 2 shrimp here.
Server: (in a kind but unapologetic manner) yes, the maximum for the lunch menu.

Lesson learned, note to self, when looking to fulfill my lunch vision, pass Sweet Lime for they are unable to deliver!
author: sumaya g.

description: Good food, good service. The menu items are a little pricey for the serving size.
author: Elise L.

description: I love Thai food and this is one of the best in town. The guys who serve were very friendly and they even recommended the dishes. It's quite and good for a date or business dinner. They decorate the dishes well and food is also delicious as it looks.
author: Jagan B.

description: Great spot in the neighborhood for thai food. Quaint with great decor and friendly staff. Ordered the shrimp green curry but with bamboo shoot instead of the green beans and the pad kee mao. Both were spot on. Don't get the sticky rice though it's quite sticky. Opt for jasmin instead.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
I believe in Phoenixes, just like I believe in Santa and am happy that Sweet Lime Thai has risen in Neecha Thai's place.

Like Neecha, Sweet's serves fresh and delicious dishes. Their menu is smaller, but they have a good variety. 

We had:
- Fresh Rolls: a lovely, light appetizer with fresh avocado, lettuce, mint, carrots and cucumber, served with a peanut dip.
- Papaya Salad: a nice crunch and mix of flavors.
- Pad Si-Ew (pork or shrimp option): a bit salty for my palate. I'd try a different dish next time.
- Their dishes are presented with a nice garnish of frills & orchid.

Lunch Menu: http://www.sweetlimethaicuisine.com/lunch_menu.pdf
Dinner Menu: http://www.sweetlimethaicuisine.com/dinner_menu.pdf

Located at the corner of Sutter & Steiner, their peaceful dining room is a great place to have a conversation while sharing a meal. Their service is super nice. Here's to good will and good food.
author: Cathy K.

description: We were on our way to another Thai restaurant but as we were walking in that direction we came upon Sweet Lime and decided to eat there instead. Boy were we pleasantly surprised!  The portions are a bit smaller than we were used to, but the taste of the food was exceptional. We ordered the shrimp Tom Yum soup which was very flavorful. The green and red curry dishes were on point (although I wish the green curry dish had more bamboo shoots and less squash). The shrimp Pad Thai dish was excellent. They use thinner noodles than the standard noodles which was a nice change. The beef pad see ew was ok, nothing out of the ordinary.  But the highlight was the mango sticky rice!  The mangos were so sweet and beautifully sliced and wrapped around the sticky purple rice. Sprinkled on top were roasted mung beans. My description may not sound appetizing, but the roasted Mung beans added the perfect crunch to this sweet dish. So yummy!  My kids devoured it.
author: Jane M.

description:
Had a great experience my first time eating here. Our table was ready when we arrived and the staff provided great service. Everyone was super friendly and answered our all our questions thoroughly. We had the tom kha soup, chicken pad Thai, green curry with veggies, and tapioca pudding. 
Was a great meal, would totally eat here again
author: Luke T.

description: Food was good and service was great.  Prices are a little on the higher side for thai food but quality and location support it.
author: Sami S.

description:
I have not actually sat down at the restaurant to eat, but it looks like a nice place and every time I've been in there during lunch hours, it's not too crowded. I first tried this place because it's close to my work. I walked in and placed a take out order. When it came time to pay, I found out they only accept credit card for orders over $15, but my order was about $8. They let me use my credit card anyway (and I left an extra large tip). While I waited for the food, they offered me tea, which I thought was a nice bonus. 

The portions look small, but they're pretty filling. And they pack their rice into cute little shapes. Green curry is my go-to.
author: Christy Y.

description:
I checked in on Yelp after sitting down at the restaurant and was excited to see the good 4-star reviews.  Someone suggested the Pad See Ew under quick tips, so I got just that.  

It was bland and greasy.  It wasn't horrible...but it wasn't good.  Ordered the shrimp (as opposed to pork) for $1 more and got exactly 3 shrimps in the whole dish.

Not one time did someone come over to see how we were doing or to refill our water.  

Don't think I will be returning.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Oh Sweet Lime Thai how I love thee,
Your Avocado Salad is so good I'll order three.
The Pad Kee Mao is spicy, Limeade is sweet,
GrubHub delivers fast, my life is complete.

Seriously y'all - Sweet Lime Thai is the best.  Fresh ingredients, appropriate portions, great variety of different dishes, and very fast delivery.

My favorites:  Avocado & Shrimp Salad, Pad Kee Mao, Fresh Rolls, Vegan Rolls,  Angel Wings, any of the curries.  And to drink - their namesake: Sweet Limeade.

I've never eaten at the restaurant itself as I've always ordered on GrubHub, but I imagine it's even more fresh onsite.  Great stuff!
author: Jennica S.

description: The food here was excellent. I eat a lot of authentic Thai food in Houston and this place was was better than some of the places I've been to. Save room for dessert because their tapioca pudding and black sticky rice with mangos are delicious. The service was also very friendly.
author: Rachel B.

description: The worst service ever! And because of that, we didn't give tips. I know it's rude but they really deserved it. After all The employees chased us to outside of the restaurant to ask for TIPS and they told us that this is America, you must put Tip!!!!! i said I know but you guys offered such a terrible services. They were arguing for 5 mins and force us to put tips. Honestly, I've never seen this kind of restaurant before!! The food was too salty and OVERPRICED. Because we dressed up casual so they didn't offer us any services. The employees were gossiping the customers in the whole time about the tips! (They didn't notice that I'm Thai) we were waiting too long for the water and the waiter tried to force us to order expensive dishes, so we got a bbq chicken for $19. It's incredibly costly definitely not going back and don't recommend this restaurant!
author: Sompatson S.

description:
I had such a delicious meal last week that I decided to stop by again to try their other dishes. 

Fried rice: 5/5 stars. Very tasty and has a slight touch of Thai basil. Will order again.

Red curry: 4 stars. Good.

Green papaya salad: 1 star. Salty, very sour...& fishy! They definitely added too much fish sauce. I asked the owner about the dish and her reply was that it's the authentic way to make it. I prefer the way Krung Thai (SJ) & Yukol Place (SF) make theirs.

Tom Yum Goong: 1 star. Salty & sour. Inauthentic because they used the button mushrooms instead of the black Asian mushrooms (don't know what they're called), no kaffir lime leaves, no lemongrass, not spicy, small shrimp & very fishy taste. Please change your recipe.

Tapioca: delicious! It was on the house, however, w/ 3 of us they only gave us a small plate w/ 3 spoons to share. Seriously?!? Might as well not give it to us for free! I honestly do not want to catch a cold or flu from my co-workers.

My first experience was with their shrimp pad thai and fried banana coconut ice cream which was phenomenal! Will definitely come back for more-- but not for the papaya salad nor tom yum soup.
author: linh d.

description:
Much improved thai restaurant from when I first visited when they first opened. 

1. They prepare the food in a timely manner
2. Warm and iced thai tea are enjoyable
3. The Pad See Ew was perfectly cooked 
4. The sticky mango rice dessert had an amazing presentation 

It is my new go to thai restaurant in pacific heights for dining in and taking out!
author: Chirag V.

description:
Dinner for four included the spicy crispy chicken ( "angel" ) wings (not true to the menu description, not spicy, not crispy and drowned in sauce that was oddly sweet), fried fish of the day "red trout"  which is not commonly seen on a Thai menu tasted like it had been soaked in a sugar sauce for a week, brown rice (basic but perfectly cooked), egg plant stuffed w/ chicken & shrimp (not really a stuffed egg plant more like an egg plant fillet w/ the topping (dish was just ok) , chicken & kabocha squash w/ red curry, seemed like the combo of ingredients worked well it was the highlight of the meal. 

Got to the restaurant at maybe 9:45PM, were the only customers. We were a chatty crowd  they locked the front door at 10PM, but  as time went on to 10:30 then 10:45 the great service continued ( ? maybe because we were the only customers)

Thought the food was forgettable, and odd. Everything seemed sweeter than it should be (maybe that is why it is called Sweet Lime). Most dishes had a  garnish of deep fried basil... thought that was funny, must be their signature touch (maybe they should rename to "Sweet Basil"). There was a time when diners were impressed with deep fried basil.... but I kinda think that time has passed.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Loved this place! Just moved to pac heights and really wanted to find a good Thai place. This place is great to go to and sit down and it's also great for delivery. I'm a big curry fan and they are sure to make their's super spicy which i love but you can always adjust the spiciness. The noodles are great as well and they're very quick. My new go to Thai place!
author: Carly G.

description: These folks were super helpful with gluten free options. The flavors were excellent, it is small and busy yet good service. I will return again when I am in the city.
author: April W.

description: I can not believe I still feel so awful about my food I ordered here.  I had chicken with eggplant, sqaush and basil over rice.  The portion was made for a child's dish.  They used the salad and the rice to fill in.  It was also so bland and distasteful. I felt robbed of my money since I paid for nothing.  I used to go in there frequently.  Now I refuse to. I should have listened to my friends who stopped going there too.  The place was not crowded like it used to be.  Do you wonder why? My rating should be NO STARS!!!
author: Valerie L.

description:
Better quality than many Thai restaurants. Delicious pad thai and red curry. Nice atmosphere. The restaurants on Divisadero
near UCSF Mount Zion are usually very crowded at lunchtime. We found this nice relaxing spot only 2 blocks away in a quiet neighborhood with excellent food and service.
author: S S.

description:
SO GOOD! And straight up affordable. Portions are big enough for leftovers, but not so big to make you worry about why they're willing to give away that much food for free, you know what I mean? 

I prefer take-out, but the in-house service is happy and smiley. 

Best dish so far is the pad si-ew with wheat gluten (seitan). An interesting dish is the Sweet Lime Suki--beware, it's hotter than you think it will be. Yellow curry, also excellent. Honestly, not sure you can go wrong here. 

And vegetarians, rejoice! Pretty much every dish can be made without meat. (That said, if you're vegan, or you don't want to accidentally eat fish, inquire about their use of fish sauces and meat-based broths... not sure about that stuff).
author: Allison S.

description:
It was a dark and stormy night...seriously, did you see the rain the other night?!

My friend F and I had swung by to OTD and had to leave (much to our embarrassment) because they didn't have any soup or noodles on the menu (really?!).
In any case, they were gracious and we left and weren't sure where to go.
I suggested Sweet Lime as I had seen it as it opened a few weeks ago but hadn't had a chance to experience it.

We walked in and immediately felt better. We were out of the rain, and had walked into an almost meditative and relaxing environment not filled with chaotic noise and the clattering of plates and utensils. There were other diners there, but they too seemed to be drawn in by the relaxing atmosphere and weren't yelling at eachother across the table or on their cell phones.

We were quickly seated and brought menus and waters with cucumbers (nice touch) and greeted by a super friendly waiter.

She and I decided on splitting a couple of appetizers and ordering soups (YAY!) . She had the Kreung  something-or-other and I had the wonton soup.

Both were fantastic! Light but flavorful broths. Mine was chock full of wontons and greens with super tender pork slices. Hers had glass noodles, oodles of tofu and pork that she said was well spiced.

The spring rolls were awesome with avocado, carrots, mint and lettuce. And our fried imperial rolls were super tasty. I don't know what it was they put into them, but they were really good. I woke up this morning craving them.

I look forward to trying their pad thai and curries, because if what I  had at last night's meal was any indication, I will be pleasantly surprised next time.

I think it will do well in the neighborhood, as Neecha has left. Sweet Lime's  menu is more limited, but I think the quality of the food makes it easy to select from and I can't wait to try it again!
author: Kathy K.

description: Place was cute small and convenient. Food was very good and filling! Thai tea was tasty.. Had Pad Si Ew.
author: Maxine M.

description:
Quiet easy place to patronize. 
I wanted to love it. The servers were really nice.
But, I didn't.
The chicken in the red curry was dark meat and rubbery, though the sauce was good, especially over the sticky rice.
The papaya salad was a little too tomatoey.
The fresh rolls were very good, especially with the touch of avocado.
author: Andrew K.

description: Great neighborhood spot! We ordered the thai spring rolls, avocado salad, green curry, sweet and sour duck, and pad thai - all were yummy! The owner was very friendly and came over a couple times.  Apparently they do half off bottles of wine on Tuesdays!
author: Kat A.

description: I had one of the most lovely dinners I have had since moving to the Bay three years ago at Sweet Lime tonight. The atmosphere was lovely and the staff welcoming and helpful. We had an unusual duck larb which we enjoyed very much - so many flavors and the textures were just right. We liked everything we tried and plan to come back to try more as soon as we can! As for the other reviewers lamenting the lack of flavor, that was not true of the Ginger Salmon or the Thai Herbed Rice with Chicken that we tried - the flavors were complex and delicious.  The servings were not huge but the quality of the ingredients was high. We were thrilled to find this gem!
author: Holly F.

description: the food is great! the service, not so much. FYI, 18% gratuity for groups of 6 or more, even if they get you orders wrong. ive gone to this place several times over the past 6 years, same story: awesome food, eh service.
author: Marquesa V.

description: Great food!!!! I want to give it 5 stars, the food is truly excellent ! Spring rolls, Mee korb, Salmon curry were all fantastic . Owner super niceee!!!
author: Tharathorn S.

description: The food was delicious, service could have been better, but we were very satisfied with our meal. Our favorites were the Tom kha coconut soup, the crispy tilapia fish in tamarind sauce, and the pad Thai. Overall really good food and cute place.
author: Hanna B.

description:
Got their Pad Se Eew and Won Ton soup.
Both tasted good.

Portions were not large, but adequate.

The thing that stood out was their specials board.  The dishes on there looked amazing, but i didn't see it till after i ordered.  Definitely want to come back and try other dishes here.
author: Steven F.

description: Delicious food, pretty ambience, and good service! This is a great little spot to dine in or takeout Thai in Pac Heights. The only downside is that portions tend to be on the small side. But I've always really enjoyed every single item ordered. Two thumbs up!
author: Hanna W.

description: My husband and I really want to like this place.  It's only a couple of blocks from our apartment and the people seem nice.  Unfortunately the food is just not good.   I've had the pad kee mao, the pad prik king, and the pad ka prow.  It's always the same problem: BLAND.  Absolutely no spice whatsoever.  I will say we usually do take out, so maybe it's better if you eat there.
author: Marina M.

description:
3.5 Stars

4 stars for food quality, service, and menu diversity
3 stars for portion size and cost

Okay, so even though this is probably one of the better Thai restaurants in Lower Pac Heights, I won't be coming back again for a while.

PROS: 
- Probably one of the most diverse Thai menus I've seen in a long time! Not only do they just have your standard pads and curries (even though they have those) they also have lots of stir fries, appetizers, and entrees. Almost anything that has regular meat in it can be made vegetarian with the substitute of tofu or braised gluten they offer (AWESOME FOR VEGETARIANS!) Their tofu was super firm and well marinated, seriously, tofu lover's HEAVEN. They also have a Vegan Crispy Roll with Taro root for you to try! 
- Service is wonderful. Our waiter was extremely attentive and courteous and the owner even came to talk to me and my BF for almost 10 minutes after we sat down. She chatted with us about the Jazz Festival that day and the surrounding area, super sweet lady!
- Food is well plated, fresh, and delicious! I got the fresh roll to share with the boy and  the mint leaves in it complimented it super well. Their peanut sauce was different than the normal ones you usually encounter but was still so good. I got the Samm Kasat which was a spicy green pepper stir fry with eggplant, bell peppers, and tofu. I asked for medium spicy and it was EXACTLY that. It was really delicious (I'm pretty sure I don't have to rave about the AMAZING tofu again). I also ordered a Thai coffee which was not too bad but nothing too special or amazing.
-Spiciness. Unlike most Thai places that usually don't take you seriously when you ask for your food spicy, this place will do exactly what you want. I've felt that when I ask for my dish to be spicy at most Thai restaurants they usually ignore me because they don't think I can handle it. Well this place, definitely honors your request. A HUGE plus!

CONS: 
- PORTION SIZE. My dish was TINY. It was a tiny plate of stir fry that cost me $13 without rice while my bf's standard dish of pad thai which was almost 2x bigger cost $9. What?! How does this make any sense. My friend ordered a salmond dish and it was MINISCULE and cost her over $10. Ridiculous, portion sizes are no bueno here. 
- Small restaurant. If you're coming in a large group, definitely make reservations! This isn't that big of a con but just a warning that this place DOES get crowded FAST.
- Salty as the DEAD SEA. Even though my Samm Kasat was pretty tasty, I could have done with about HALF the amount of salt in this dish. It was sooooooo salty I felt like I had just gone swimming in the Dead Sea and swallowed a gulp full of water. 
- Limited alcohol selection. I feel that most of the Thai restaurants I've gone to in the area usually have a pretty wide selection of alcoholc drinks for me to choose from. From a lychee martini just to a variety of unique beers. While this place has your standard Singha beer and a couple of wines, that's it! I'd like to go to a place where I can get a yummy mojito to pair with my meal.

Conclusion, food is pretty darn good but definitely NOT worth the price. The portions are ridiculously small and I really honestly think you can find something that tastes just as good and get a better bang for your buck somewhere else. True, it's probably one of the better Thai places in Pac Heights (definitely a million times better than Thai Stick) but not really worth the money. I'll probably find myself coming here once in a while if I'm in the area, craving Thai food, and don't want to travel too far. Otherwise, I think I'll try to find somewhere else that will give me more bang for my buck.
author: Vicki L.

description: Had it delivered - very good.  Would order again, not incredible, but very good food.  Chicken w/ Pumpkin curry and eggplant were tasty.
author: michael d.

description: Ok, im really surprised at the good reviews here. Does anyone know what thai food is supposed to taste like? There wasn't even a chicken or beef mince larb, the papaya salad was atrocious, the mamasan curry was so very not a masaman curry. The food wasnt horrible, but I was craving thai food and it was "thai-like" or "asian-ish" at best. Many more better thai places around town.
author: E B.

description: Very slow service despite the fact that we were the only people in the place. Food was mediocre at best and many of my diner mates were quite disappointed with their meals. No flow to the dining experience as one persons entree' came out 20 minutes after everyone else. With so many incredible Thai cuisine options in SF, I'd chose a different one than Sweet Lime.
author: stephanie c.

description: Their deep fried Tilapia is amazing. A huge stand-out from your typical Thai dishes.
author: Ken W.

description: Great subtle flavors, sweet mellow service, good veggie options (love the green curry with buckwheat noodles). Good deal for lunch in a quiet location.
author: Tom D.

description:
Checked out Sweet Lime Thai Cuisine with some friends, the waitress was extremely friendly and helpful with recommendations. She continued to check back on our table and chat with us about various things.

I asked for my food super spicy, and they did spice it up some. The waitress came by later with some freshly chopped peppers she had just picked up at the farmer's market for me to try (although she warned me not to).  

The food was pretty good, I had the green vegetable curry with tofu. There wasn't that much tofu nor veggies for that matter. The curry itself was good but I prefer to actually feel like I'm eating something besides just coconut milk and curry paste. We also shared a couple appetizers, the appetizers were pretty small (and the curry wasn't a very large dish either). I thought the spring roll was pretty underwhelming. 

They brought us a free tapioca pudding for dessert. It had a nice coconut flavor to it but again not really a fan. Overall, I thought the staff was extremely nice, attentive, and fun but that the food left something to be desired.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Mango with sticky rice = SO GOOD, and great presentation!

I had the green beans with duck. They tried to warn me off that combination, citing too much greasiness, but were gracious and made it anyway when I insisted. VERY good. (I love greasy, hah! And duck fat is great with green beans anyway.)

To be honest I was a bit meh about the fresh rolls.

Lovely plating, for sure. The orchids are a nice touch. :D

Prices on some things were a bit high for how much food you got... though I guess it's San Francisco, and kind of in the Pacific Heights area anyway, so that's not too bad, considering.

The wait staff were sweet and attentive.

The green tea was excellent! Be sure to fish the bag out before it oversteeps.

I'm going to be craving that duck...
author: Ev L.

description: Mediocre food (at best) and deplorably slow service pretty much sums it up...maybe I was expecting it to be as good as Neecha was in its prime since it is in the same location...  I did give it two stars because the fried banana and coconut ice cream was excellent...
author: Robert G.

description:
Overly saucey to make up for the taste.  To top it off sauce was too salty and too sweet overwhelming the actual food.  It is also the same sauce for appetizers and for entrees.  Did I mention the word sauce?

Lychee tea was jasmine tea.  After complaining waitress just said it is lychee.  Must be 95% jasmine with a drop of lychee syrup? Either way do not order this garbage. 

Nice things:  It is quiet and not crowded.  Duck rolls were delicious...minus the, well, SAUCE!!!!
author: Mr C.

description:
This is a truly great Thai experience.  

The food is superb.  

Every aspect of design is haute Thai - food presentation, table settings, glassware.  The setting is elegant and romantic - every table is a good table.  

There is a wine list that includes some very pleasant and appealing old world wines.  

The servers are beautifully dressed in stylish Thai attire, and are Michelin Star attentive.

Highly recommend the Avocado Salad, Papaya Salad, all of the rolls, curries, and Pad Thai.  For dessert, the plate of fried bananas with coconut ice cream reaches divinity status.  Absolutely the only weak item on the menu is the Tom Yum soup - a bland disappointment.  But who cares?  One can get Tom Yum anywhere.
author: Patricia P.

description:
-perfect again, this visit meeting Nee, the owner and most gracious hostess!

Spicy Angel Wings
 Pineapple FR
 Massaman
 Pad Kee Mao CK 
 Panang Pork
 Nam Tok Neua 
 Pad Thai COMBO
 Pad Kra Thiem Pork
 Mango Thai Coconut Milk Tapioca 
 Thai Iced Coffee
 Thai Iced T
 Singha Beer

 xcha Jasmine rice fa soak up the extra curries.

and will be back AGAIN to sample several other unchartered dishes uniquely theirs!

Truly, food of the gods!!
author: Clifford L.

description: This is a great option for people who want to avoid MSG.  They are very conscious of any dietary restrictions and even offer a gluten free menu.  The curry and noodle dishes are very consistent.  The staff is super friendly and I highly recommend this place.
author: Karlito S.

description:
I love their green curry with pork and eggplant! It is amazing, the portion size is huge and the curry is the perfect consistency nice and creamy. The pork is tender and they give you a ton of eggplant and other veggies.

The shrimp salad is also a really solid dish. It comes on a bed of lettuce with marinated shrimp, avocado, crispy shallots, and a fantastic lime dressing that ties the entire salad together.

I have yet to eat at the restaurant I have just called a head to get food to go.
author: Stephanie T.

description: The food was good, although, I order fried rice and I got a string curry flavor in this rice. Then wings also were good but I got a fish flavor in it, but it was worth it. A bug no no I'm in the hospital, and this is the first time they delivery person wanted me to go down. I'm at a hospital as a patient, asking for delivery... Why will I go get food.. The part that I disliked the most, he lied and said he couldn't get the food. Also, I guess they were busy because I got my food like almost an hour later. Food is good not wow, I just don't know everyone expect something that one is used to.
author: Ricardo H.

description:
GLUTEN FREE FRIENDLY!!!

I can't tell you how many mixed messages I've gotten about whether a Thai restaurant can make a dish (esp the curries) GF or not.  Not only was the server very very helpful...she took a menu, crossed off the 7 items I couldn't order (yes, you got that right....it was only a handful of items that could NOT be made GF), and assured me they could do anything from scratch.

The food was very good.
author: Q L.

description:
My dining companion and I shared a papaya salad, the Tofu Kra-Prow-Krob, and the Pad Prik Khing with tofu. Papaya salad was light and tasty, just as it should be. 

The Tofu Kra-Prow-Krob was also very tasty. The tofu was nice and crispy on the outside. The sauce was sweet, as advertised, and might be too sweet for some. 

We also really enjoyed the Pad Prik Khing.

Word to the wise -- the white rice, which was good, costs extra.

Service was excellent, even as I emptied my water glass about every ten minutes due to this unseasonably warm weather!
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Pad thai + drunken noodle + masaman curry + spring rolls = Every Sunday paired with GoT
author: megan l.

description: Had a hard time to understand their English in ordering. O-M-G! I love the curry esp the red ck curry!!!! Delivery driver was friendly , spoke English very well and very fast delivered less than I expected also he informed by using text 5 minutes before upon on arrival. Definitely will stick with this restaurant.
author: Tom L.

description: Ordered from here via GrubHub last night, and it took OVER 2 HOURS (and several phone calls chasing them down) for me to receive my food.  Once the food finally did arrive, I can say that it was actually pretty good in regards to FLAVOR, but the portions were ridiculously small.  Ultimately not worth the money spent or time wasted waiting & chasing them down via GrubHub.  It should never be that difficult.  Never again...
author: Eric H.

description: Just ordered delivery of a supposedly Thai dinner that must have been airlifted in from Ames, Iowa for tastelessness! Completely and utterly tasteless rubbery squid, spring rolls like coils of cardboard and steamed vegetables the texture and taste of legos! In 24 years of living in San Francisco, this was "almost" comically as bad as eating sand from Aquatic Park! The worst so-called "Thai" food I have ever eaten here in San Francisco.
author: Tom C.

description: Fantastic food!  Excellent service!  Delightful spot to recharge ones tummy and soul.
author: Dana E.

description:
I was craving some Thai food for lunch and jumped quickly to some Yelp reviews for a recommendation. It was a toss up between Sweet Lime and and My Ivy Thai (both of which had 4 stars). 

Sweet lime offers a clean and comfortable environment. Large windows allow natural light to flood into this restaurant in Pacific Heights. The staff was friendly and the food tasty and quickly served. The entree sizes varied so be warned. I got a Pad Thai which was a great size but some of my comrades could have used some more sustenance on their plates.  

The walk is quick and convenient from any part of UCSF Mt. Zion Campus.
author: Calvin G.

description:
I tried delivery for the first time. I had the vegan crispy roll, which had good flavor, but was very small in portion. It was much smaller than most spring rolls you would get from other Thai restaurants. I would say it hits the spot for one person, but probably not for two to share. 

I also had the green curry with pork and eggplant. It was nice and spicy and the pork was soft and moist. I will order from them again and try other dishes. My food was delivered quickly, too!
author: Marissa S.

description:
DELICIOUS!

I'm a Thai connoisseur and I have tried just about every place in Oakland. Thought I had found the best Thai (Chai Thai Noodle). This place is even more amazing that Chai Thai Noodle. Hands down my favorite Thai place now.

Pros:
1. Very clean, inviting, low-key, slightly romantic setting inside.
2. Staff was very friendly
3. Good menu selection
4. Had a great green curry, a great fried tofu in crispy basil (YUM!) and a green bean dish.

Cons:
1. Slightly more pricey than your normal Thai; but worth it!
2. It is in San Fran and I am in Oakland! BOO!!!
author: Jana C.

description:
Just moved across the street & was really hoping this could be our new go-to Thai place. Unfortunately, we're going to have to keep looking. 

When we got there for dinner, there was only one other table in there finishing up. We ordered curry puffs & two entrees w/ white rice. Curry puffs came out & they were pretty good. You could tell they weren't previously frozen. Feeling optimistic! 

Then our entrees came out. I ordered a green curry & the boyfriend ordered some other similar entree. They bring out our entrees then tell us they're out of white rice. Keep in mind that we were the only table there at this point so it's not like they were so busy they served the last portion to another table and didn't have time to tell us. First, how does a Thai restaurant run out of white rice?? Second, why didn't you tell us either when we ordered, when our appetizers came out, or the ten minutes between finishing our appetizers and waiting for our entrees? They offered brown rice but I hate brown rice so I said no thanks. Then they offered sticky rice and we reluctantly agreed. So as our two entrees are sitting on our table getting cold, they go on to make the sticky rice. 10 minutes later and we get some subpar rice to go with the dry, way overcooked meat in the curry. 

I was less than pleased. Food tastes like a 2.5 star average restaurant while priced like 4 star. Service was just dumb.
author: Lele L.

description:
Authentic and delicious.  I went with a few friends and we shared the fresh rolls and mango to start.  The fresh rolls were exactly what you wanted them to be and the mango salad was delicious and perfectly balanced: the mango was ripe but not overripe and there was enough chicken that it actually added to the overall flavor of the dish.

For a main, we ordered the Makhur Song Kreung, which the server excitedly informed us was his favorite dish and was still prepared as it used to be prepared hundreds of years ago.  Maybe he was lying, but who cares?  It was fantastic.  You MUST order this dish.  We also ordered the pineapple fried rice and a yellow curry, and I have to say that everything was absolutely great.  I'm so glad that we found this place!
author: Ashley B.

description:
I went here for the first time last weekend with some of my roommates. It's right next to my house and I've always been interested in going so we finally made plans before going to the kabuki theatre and went. 

Man was I impressed! To begin, the service was outstanding that manager was joking around with us the whole evening and making sure we were having a good time :) My roommates seemed to really like what they ordered and it did look good. But I was totally blown away by my meal. I ordered the pineapple fried rice(my favorite Thai dish) and to my surprise they actually served it to me inside an actual carved out pineapple, one of the coolest presentations I've seen. It was the best pineapple fried rice I've ever had by far. I'll definitely be going here again!
author: Blake L.

description:
I ordered take away from here last night.
They were out of fresh rolls and it was only 7:10pm when I called, so that was disappointing. 
We got curry puffs instead which were delicious- which were small crescent shaped fries puffs and only 3 for the size and price,$7.00, they should have made it 4 per order.
The soup -Kaeng Jued- was hot but in my opinion lacked a bit of flavour and could have had more chicken & shrimp.
The pad Thai was the real disappointment- lacking any flavour (very low on the tamarind) not much green onion, not enough chicken and the noodles were all congealed and stuck together - granted it was take away but I have had take away Pad Thai before and the noodles wen properly covered with sauce aren't as stuck. 
The cashew chicken was delicious! Good sauce, lovely flavour and a good amount of chicken. 
The service on pick up was super friendly and hospitable.
Would I order from here again? Sorry not any time soon.....
author: Victoria R.

description:
Yeah, I don't think I'll be back. This place, in its previous incarnation, was FAR better. 

Came in today to help satisfy the cravings of a friend who wanted Thai food - I was trying to figure out where to go, and we drove by this place en route to the Inner Richmond, and with a parking space just around the corner, my friend and I decided to come on in. 

Got seated, got handed menus, and the place is pretty inside - they did a nice refresh of the location. Water gets dispensed, and she also takes our order at the same time; my friend orders the Pad See Ew, and I got the wonton soup. 

The owner is graviting towards a table of 2 men in the back who are going to order wine. She actually sits down with them to discuss the nuances of some Prosecco on the menu - I hope that they are regulars, and that she's not just giving them the attention because they are spending more money. 

Food arrives, and my friend says her pad see ew is bland. Also, she ordered the shrimp, and she got exactly 3 shrimp in it. I find this to be somewhat unacceptable, but she's not one to really raise a fuss over the food, so I let it go. She also said that the dish was very greasy, even for the stir-fried nature of it. 

My wontons tasted weird - not quite like pork, and not quite like shrimp, and also it seemed that the meat in them wasn't ground up fine enough. Pork was dry for sitting in the broth, and kind of flavorless. Noodles were ok, and the broth was pretty good. 

Nobody stopped by during the meal to ask how we were. In fact, my friend noticed that one of the servers was drinking a glass of white wine. On the clock, at 1 pm. Really?!

No thanks.
author: Jessica S.

description: Tasty and flavorful with great service and beautiful, thoughtfully presented dishes.
author: Aranya K.

description: Ordered the papaya salad, pad kee mao with beef, and coconut shrimp w/ green curry and a bottle of wine. Food was delicious and service was fast, once they made it to our table. Not too many people on a Sinday but we were ok with that. Atmosphere was super cute with dimmer lighting, trees lit outside, and some nice jazz music. Presentation was cute especially when rice was served in a heart shape.  Not your traditional mom and pop thai shop but not in a bad way.
author: Corey M.

description:
Joined our good friends who recommended this fine restaurant.

Had Honey BBQ Lamb (We Especially Loved the Lamb), Beef Pad Thai,  Avocado Salad, Kabocha Squash, Braised Catfish. We thoroughly enjoyed the dinner!
author: GARY C.

description:
Delicious! Live in the east bay and have yet to find a really good Thai place. This may just be my go-to.

Came with a friend for lunch and had: 
Mango salad - fresh flavors, perfect portion for 2-3 to share
Eggplant special that someone else mentioned- lots of complex flavors, good texture
Fried tofu - we called it "cookies" because it was both lunch and dessert. Perfect, sticky sauce with just the right amount of spice.

We stayed late talking and they didn't rush us out, even though they were closed for the lunch hour. No dirty looks, just closed our tab and sat comfortably for an additional 30 minutes.

It is a teeny bit pricey, but I'll pay extra for really fresh food and great service.

YUM
author: Julie M.

description: Amazing and full of flavor ! Chicken pad Thai was amazing and the fried banana dessert is the perfect ending. Will definitely be back !! Also, if you like them on Facebook you get a free drink. :)
author: Y R.

description:
Can I just say, I love this place. Quiet neighborhood Thai joint with a touch of class.

Positives:
- Food, DELICIOUS. I have a hard time forcing myself to stray from my favorite dishes cause I love them so much! My favorites are Chicken Pad Kee Mao and Samm Kasat (chef's special). Everything else I have tried here is equally tasty. Warning: Many dishes automatically come very spicy.
- Extremely kind, attentive servers. One of the owners (I assume) has stopped by to ask how we are enjoying everything almost every time I've dined here, just one gesture that shows this restaurant cares about quality.
- Nice, quiet, relaxed ambiance. Fresh orchids and soft lighting class it up and make it a nice place for a date.
- Quick service, never a wait.

I can't think of any negatives worth mentioning. The portions aren't huge, and it's not the cheapest Thai food in town, but it gets my vote for the best neighborhood Thai joint with consistently great food and great service. I always leave very happy :)
author: Remi X.

description:
I've only been here once but the experience was so positive, it deserves a 5-star review, and I'll certainly be coming back again.

First, the ambiance and decor are great. True, not essential to a great dining experience, but it's worth mentioning.

OK - the food. I'm a vegetarian and saw there were a ton of veggie options on the menu, all marked clearly with an icon so there was no guesswork. There was one dish that seemed intriguing, and I had never seen it before, so I ordered it: kabocha squash with basil, garlic, egg and jalapeno.

The dish came and it was gorgeous. Right before I started to eat, the owner (?) came by and told me this was an unusual dish, something you don't typically find in restaurants, but that (her?) grandmother used to make it. It was DELICIOUS. The squash, garlic, egg and basil were delicately flavored - very high-quality ingredients, perfectly prepared - and the jalapenos were there to kick it up a notch. I almost licked the plate clean.

To top it all off, a half orange, beautifully carved, was given to me with my check. It was the perfect ending  to a perfect meal.
author: Jason M.

description:
Because this place is close to my work, and they are a part of the GOPAGO app, I decided to try it. They are efficient and have great customer service.

The Sweet Lime Suki noodles are tasty.  Comes with generous helpings of prawns and meat.  The flavor is unusual, and not like anything I've had before, but it's my usual lunch dish there now.  

I also enjoy the duck larb (I've always had it with pork, chicken, or beef), as it is a great traditional Thai dish.  The Thai spring roll is also very delicious.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Great little corner restaurant with a very welcoming staff. We were greeted and seated promptly with drinks in hand right away. My friend knew the manager so he had her select which dishes to try. They were all quite good but the green curry was phenomenal. I'm not even a big curry person but I will definitely be getting that again next time. Pad Thai was solid as well; nothing better than good Thai food and Singhas to start your night.

Parking was pretty easy to find on the street, great place to eat before a movie at Kabuki.
author: Jeff O.

description:
Sorry, this place has really gone down hill since the restaurant changed owner.
Today, three of us had lunch and selected from the lunch menu. Two of us had the silver noodle dish. It came with a side of RICE, Really? If I knew, i wouldn't have ordered this dish. My dish literally had two pieces of chicken, TWO! It's been one hour of my meal and I'm starving. Yes, I didn't eat the rice, why should I? 

Then our bill came, their suggested tips start at 18%, 20%, 25% what happen to 15%? The service was cool but I'm"m not paying 18% for lunch that sucks and I'm still hungry.  

Won't be going back any time soon. BTW, There were only three parties there including us.
author: Lu Lu F.

description:
I was going to give this place 3 stars, but they had two aspects that bumped this review to a 4.

I came here with my boyfriend and a few other friends.  I have heard about the dish called "drunken noodles" or pad kee mao, so I decided to try it here.  The portion was smaller than I expected, especially when I looked around the table and I felt that everyone else got a bit more.  The dish itself was pretty good; the chicken was juicy and there were hints of basil and garlic.  I tried my boyfriend's pad see ew, and I thought that the soy sauce overpowered the dish.  I also had a sampling of the yellow curry, and that was good.  The pad thai looked very appealing, so I may order that the next time I come here.

The service was great, which was one of the reasons that I bumped this to a 4.  The waitresses were all very kind and attentive.  The other reason I raised it to the a 4 was their mango and sticky rice, which was absolutely AMAZING.  The mango was perfectly ripe: great texture and very sweet.  I'm not sure what kind of rice it was, but it was purple colored,  topped with condensed milk (I think .. or some other type of sweet milk) and these crispy rice cracker things.  It was a bit pricey ($6.50), but I thought it was worth it.  I think it was the best I ever had!
author: Can C.

description:
As always I never do anything out of town unless it is Yelp approved! Using my trusty yelp app during a recent visit to san fran, I stumbled across this apparently new thai restaurant. We were drawn in by the byob, though they do charge a small corkage fee. 

The owners and waitresses here are PAINFULLY NICE!! The service was just unmatched. I really want this restaurant to do well, because it is so rare to meet genuine people who really care about their business, and more importantly their customers, like this. But, don't just go here to help them out... THE FOOD IS JAMMIN!

The selection is wide and everything is amazing. We got a whole fresh bass dish. Literally caught the same day and it was amazing. So fresh. Portions were just right. The atmosphere is perfect for a casual, but intimate date or a family get-together. I just felt right at home. I wish I lived nearby let alone on the same coast.

Great meal to end a fabulous visit to san fran!
author: Jamie C.

description: Great place!  The food came quickly and everything was tasty.  The yellow curry lamb was especially flavorful, and you get a surprisingly large amount for a very reasonable price.  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes Thai food, and even people who have never tried it!
author: Angus R.

description:
Ambiance: 3.5 stars (cute and cozy)
Food: 3 stars (decent, but not special; menu did have some interesting options)
Service:4 stars (super-friendly, attentive and quick)
Value: 2 stars ($67 for two entrees, two drinks, one appetizer)
author: Ali M.

description: Food was good but the service was sooo slow that it took away from the overall experience.  Its unfortunate but I will not be going back.
author: Jake P.

description:
I ordered take-out for a 20-person film crew, and Sweet Lime Thai Cuisine had the entire order prepared and wrapped on time. They were extremely helpful and packed everything nicely in boxes so I didn't have to make so many trips back and forth to my car.

Everybody loved the food, including myself.
author: Jim D.

description: Great service and the food was good, albeit I felt like they were charging way too much for what I had. For what they were charging, I was expecting EXCEPTIONAL Thai food but, it was only slightly above average. I don't think I'd rush back here anytime soon but, might be back on a whim.
author: Jen H.

description: I've gone twice in the last few weeks, plus ordered for pick-up, so having had Sweet Lime for dinner three times in the last 3-4 weeks, I can definitively say this place is CONSISTENTLY GOOD.  Which is refreshing since so many places are hit or miss.  The owner is lovely and makes the effort to greet patrons, and the food is just totally solid.  Everything is presented nicely, the place is quietly elegant, the Thai iced tea is delicious -- it's just an all-around winner!
author: Molly P.

description: We live across the street and always get the chicken curry to go. The service is great, the food is delicious and they are always prompt.
author: Ben M.

description:
This is my favorite Thai!
I've never had better!!!
The owner noticed that I was coming in
frequently. She introduced herself, 
and we talked at length about her 
philosophy on Thai food: fresh veggies...
not too sweet, not too salty.
She is brilliant!
author: Gee K.

description: Sweet Lime Thai is great. I ordered the Pad See Ew Beef, which was great and better than most Thai restaurants, but the beef was a little dry hence the 4 stars. I also tried their Yellow Curry and I'm still thinking about. Mmmm mmm mmm. Sweet Lime Thai has terrific service and a great menu. I especially liked the little touches they've added. Whether it's the flower decoration on the table or how they serve their brown rice in the shape of a heart.
author: Stacy O.

description: This place has been consistently good, in my opinion, for the last two years that I've been eating here.  It's the best Thai food I've had in the city for a very good price considering how damn delicious everything is. It's not as good as my favorite place on Oahu but it comes real close!
author: Tamsen S.

description:
Loved everything!  We had 

Spring rolls
Pad Thai
MASSAMAN curry

Everything was solid
author: Kari M.

description: My favorite Thai food in SF. Consistently delicious. Try the Pad Thai, Cashew Chicken, Pad Prik King and the yellow curry.
author: Lauren S.

description: What a lovely Thai place! I've been to so many Thai restaurants but never got impressed by their food. This time I was definitely impressed and well served by the entire staff. I loved their green curry with coconut shrimp and juicy eggplants! Oh, and their chicken Pad Thai is to die for! Finish it with a refreshing watermelon juice!
author: Katarine Q.

description:
Pros:
Great new Thai place in the neighborhood with very friendly and authentic Thai ownership, tasty food (all the quick tip recommendations were good, like the fresh rolls), and great location.

Cons:
Totally empty on a weekday at prime dinner time.  Good for an intimate date but not as good if you want atmosphere.

Fun:
Across the street is Sweet Maple--any relation?  You tell me.
author: Mike G.

description:
