Drove past here a few days ago and saw the great reviews, so we decided to try it out last night. We were VERY impressed with the whole experience. It was not too loud, which is great for good conversation. The waitress was very nice and helpful and all of the dishes at the table were absolutely DELICIOUS!  I ordered the Pad See Ew and it was so flavorful (some places it comes too dry and not enough flavor).  
The Pad Broccoli and Snapper dish was also delicious. Can't wait to come back soon!
author: Emma A.

description: Had the Whole Talapia in sweet chili sauce. Nice flavor, quick service.  Pad Thai is freshly made.
author: Fred E.

description:
Great neighborhood Thai spot.  Very friendly staff and they are very quick.  

A surprisingly 5 star dish is the spicy angel wings.  It's everything you'd want  a chicken wing to be with an added Thai spice.  

The noodle dishes are pretty standard and satisfying.  The Thai herb chicken came with a very delightful spicy cucumber sauce that pulled the whole dish together.
author: AJ L.

description:
I used to go to Neecha Thai previously located in the same spot.  The old one was better.  I ordered the Pad-SeeYu and they made it with chicken even though the menu only lists pork and shrimp (really??!!).  The service was good.  The food tasted ok but the prices were now higher.  The menu is arranged in a manner that I found hard to navigate.  The food choices are in combinations that aren't to my liking.
I was really hoping they had the garlic prawns like Neecha but nothing even similar.  If the prices were 30% less I might go back.
author: Jeff W.

description: Excellent green curry, creamy coconut sauce. Soft shell crab was not so nice. Otherwise excellent value for money.
author: Jason B.

description:
What an absolutely wonderful restaurant!  I've made sure to get here every time I get to San Francisco (which thankfully is frequently).  The ambience is elegant and romantic.   The presentation of the food is beautiful with orchids and etc.  And last but not least, the food is out of this world.  I've tried so many things and haven't been disappointed ever!  

I've tried many of their vegetarian dishes and they are superb!  The Pad Thai and avocado salad are my favorites.  This is a must try and I guarantee that you will become a fan and frequent guest like me!
author: Betty Sue W.

description:
When is yelp gonna listen and give us half stars?  Darn you Yelp, darn you!!!

I'd give this place 4.5 stars.  We were in need of a bite to eat before our movie at Kabuki, so we found ourselves at Sweet Lime.  Deeeeliocious.  Firstly, we brought our own bottles of wine, so they immediately whisked them away from us to get them chilled on ice.  Oh, and they didn't charge us a corkage fee!  Our waitress was smiley and sweet, and the owner kept coming over to chat with us and refresh our glasses.  It was seriously some of the nicest service I've had in years.  In fact, we were so enjoying the dedicated service and the calming ambiance that we almost missed our movie!

We got the vegetarian Tom Kha, the vegetarian satays (sooooo good), and I got the yellow curry.  And we each got rice that they'd shaped in heart molds---and the brown rice was perfectly cooked.  The food came beautifully decorated with orchid petals and fresh cucumber salad but most importantly, everything was incredible tasty.  It was so refreshing to see honest, well made food that you can tell was made with care.  

If I lived somewhat nearby I'd be back sooner than later.
author: Ali L.

description:
The food is delicious, the staff is friendly and fast. 

Great options for vegetarians, quality ingredients and fabulous flavor. Good for any occasion.

My new favorite Thai place.. I highly recommend the curries and the flat noodle dishes... YUM!
author: Tiffany R.

description:
3.5-4.0

The food here is fairly tasty.. The pad thai/pad see ew are very colorful with carrot slices and other vege's, which always keeps me interested.  However, the portion size seems to be a bit lacking for the price.  It is about the same price as I am used to for pad thai, maybe ~$1 more, but the portions are smaller.   *The store has a $15 minimum on credit card use as well, which I think is bogus but hasn't really been as much of an issue for me b/c I go with my GF or other frinds.

The servers are very nice as well when talking to me & my group, and they are very attentive to water levels, etc..

Overall, the food quality is good and the servers are attentive.  Like everything else in SF, I would come here much more often if the price was cheaper.
author: James M.

description: Delicious Thai food. Small restaurant with high quality ingredients and prepared food, but big portions! I had the yellow curry with chicken. It was outstanding. My girlfriend got a dish from the Chef's specialties section with a peanut sauce. It was also amazing. Highly recommend it!
author: Chris D.

description: wonderful service, really nice people and a great atmosphere! This is a great date place and the food is very flavorful and fresh. Nice neighborhood favorite.
author: Betty W.

description: We stopped by Sweet Lime over memorial day weekend while visiting some friends in SF. The service was friendly, the food was great, and the prices were reasonable. They had us in and seated quickly. We had a duck larb appetizer that was out of this world. We also tried the curry puffs, which were solid, and a variety of soups and curries for the table, which were all good as well.
author: Leslie F.

description:
I was going adventurous this day, so I can't compare their pad thai or eggplant basil chicken to other places since I tried the yellow curry this time. They were generous with the chicken and kabocha squash, but the squash was still a bit "crunchy" for my liking. The salad that accompanies it was tasty and had a great creamy dressing. 
For dessert, I guiltily had the fried banana and coconut ice cream. Rich and refreshing and rich.... The banana was wrapped in wonton and deep fried and the coconut ice cream was sprinkled with toasted coconut. Pricier than normal Thai fair. I think I still prefer Thai Stick, Osha, or Bangkok Thai.
author: jeddie k.

description:
They lost a star because of their service.  However, it was opening night and I would be willing to reconsider given that the food was absolutely delicious. 

To Start:  Fresh Rolls - Very, very good!  Lettuce, avocado, mint + peanut sauce as well as a bunch of other fresh things that were very pleasing.  Highly recommend!

Main Course: Split Pad Thai and Red Curry w/ Chicken.  Pad Thai was probably the best I've had in a long time. Red Curry w/ Chicken & Squash - Had a nice, rich spicy flavor that was just enough kick without being overwhelming.

Desert - Complimentary Coconut Cake that was incredible.  You could taste the homemade love.

We'll definitely go back.
author: Arnie P.

description:
I've tried several Thai restaurants in the city, but Sweet Lime Basil is by far the best. Not only are all the dishes authentic and made with quality ingredients, but the experience itself never disappoints. 
The dishes are thoughtfully crafted and remind me of when I was actually in Thailand. The curries are out of this world and all of the starters I've tried are fantastic!
Rarely do you feel like an important guest at SF restaurants but the owner and staff make you feel right at home!
author: Bryant W.

description: Wow. Everything was perfect. The taste, atmosphere and the very kind owners. And we thought we had the best Thai in Seattle. Ha.
author: Tim R.

description: Excellent. Currently my favorite thai place in SF. I love going to this place after soaking at Kabuki! I wish they delivered!
author: Sky B.

description:
3 1/2 stars really, but I'm gonna bump up because I'll admit the reason I'd bump down might be a little bit doucehy (which I'll get to). 

Anyways, I hadn't been able to find good Thai food in the city and then I found Neecha (which used to be this place) and REALLY liked it. Well, less than a week after I found Neecha it was closed. I actually think I was the last person to write a review for that place when they were still open. 

I finally decided to give this place a try and REALLY liked the food! I got yellow curry for takeout and it was yummy! I feel like yellow is the least popular of the Thai curries, but I've always liked it for some reason. I can't really pinpoint anything that made Sweet Lime's yellow curry standout, but it had good texture, the chicken was tender, and the potatoes & carrots weren't too hard or mushy. I got it with brown rice (which I'll get too). 

The people who work here are really nice and they're quick with orders. I was here less than 10 minutes after I placed my order and shortly after I walked in my food was ready. One woman offered me water while I waited (even though I didn't have much of a wait), which I thought was nice. I was in here for less than five minutes, but it did seem like a nice setup, and I'd come back to dine in. 

Here's where the half star issue comes in. When I placed my order over the phone the woman who took it asked me if I wanted rice with my curry. I asked if it came with it (I know this is usually like a 50/50 chance at Thai places, but I kind of get annoyed when places charge extra), and her response was "no, but it's curry and you HAVE to get rice with it because you can't eat curry without rice." When everything is said and done I don't mind paying an extra two bucks for rice (that's what this place charges), but I thought it was a little rude for her to say this. Maybe I misunderstood her tone over the phone, but if the people who worked here weren't so nice in person this would have annoyed me more than it did. Also, I was asked if I wanted steamed rice or brown rice and when I said steamed the woman hesitated, said they were running low on it, and asked if I would mind getting brown. She also said she would only charge me a dollar for it, but when I went to pick it up I was charged two (I wasn't gonna make a big deal over a buck though). Now that I think about it, it's really not so douchey to mark this place down for this, but since the curry was yummy, the people who worked here were nice (face to face at least) I'll just post this review now with four stars while I'm still in a good mood...
author: George A.

description:
Authentic food, warm service and comfy surroundings. Two thumbs up.

Growing up in Southeast Asia I've spent lots of time in Thailand and have sampled the food from multiple Thai regions. My wife and I love Sweet Lime because the great food reminds us of being back in Thailand. 

But good food is only half of it - Nee the owner provides wonderfully warm and friendly service. Even though it was months between our first and second visit, she remembered us right away and personally served us. In spite of being very hands-on running the restaurant, she somehow finds the time to check in to see how we're doing. 

Recommended dishes: 
- Tom yum kung: classic sweet/sour soup with nice balance of lemongrass, ginger and chili flavors. Favorite with seafood
- Angel wings: succulent, garlicy and lots of spice. Topped with crispy fried basil.
- Green papaya salad: not for everyone, but authentically sour and crunchy, with delicious bits of garlic and dried shrimp.
- Mee krob: crispy fried rice noodles with sweet gravy - great combination of crunch and sweetness, nicely offset with a bit of lime acid.
- Whole fish with chili/garlic sauce: nicely fried with crispy skin contrasted by a deliciously spicy sweet sauce.


The restaurant is also nicely lit, extremely clean and has a relaxing ambiance. In a city with lots of good restaurants (and many great Thai restaurants), it's not just the great food, but the service and comfortable, tasteful surroundings that sets Sweet Lime apart.
author: JK K.

description: Thai food is normally my favorite cuisine but not in this case.   I've eaten here on two occasions and both times, I felt the food was below average.   In both cases, the food tasted OK while eating it (not extra special by any means) but afterwards it didn't digest well.   On the last occasion both my friend and I felt nauseous.  There is definitely much better Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Bob W.

description:
Good food, good service, nice touch with a complimentary dessert.

Can't say if I'll be a regular (since it is a little bit of a walk from my place) , but definitely something I would recommend for calm, peaceful weekday night to chillax and enjoy a good ambience.
author: Sumit G.

description:
To caveat my review, my expectations for Thai food may be a little high since I've traveled through Thailand, often enjoying delicious meals for miniscule prices. However, I found this place overpriced serving mediocre food at best. All the food I had at this place lacked that extra kick that lets you know your eating something good. I was particularly disappointed in their papaya salad; to which you get quite the small helping of that isn't very good at all. Matter o fact, almost all their dishes come in small portions that lack that true Thai flavor.

On the positive side, it has a very nice ambiance in a reasonably nice area of San Francisco. If the food was better I would say it is a nice place to take someone for a date.

There's better Thai places out there; go elsewhere.
author: Joe D.

description:
I live right across the street and think this place is definitely a neighborhood gem!!!  

I went the first week they were open, and felt very comfortable, the service was great, and the owner was gracious enough to come over and ask us how our experience at the restaurant was.  Since then I've been back numerous times.

I recommend the Pad Thai, Pad Si-Ew, also the Massaman, and Panang curry are great!!!

Also Thanks again for the complimentary Thai Iced Tea (to the owner if you read this)!!!
author: Pomaikai S.

description:
Although I miss Neecha Thai, Sweet Lime is DELICIOUS!
They have great service and good food.
Someone said they didn't like their pad thai, but it's the best pad thai I've ever had.... I was surprised that I liked it because normally I have problems with them so I don't like to order it again.
I'll be ordering that again and will be back to try other things.
author: M J.

description:
Practically, when I crave Thai food in the City, I think of them now.

Since my last review I went back on two occasions and found more favorite dishes - Larb Ped (Hot and Sour Duck -- it may not be on the menu - just ask them if they can make it).  This is my second favorite after fresh rolls.  Instead of using minced duck, they use sliced meat and it is just yummy.

My friend had Mussaman Beef and he loved it.  I had a taste too and I love the pineapple in it.  Totally love it too.

They now have an impressive selection of wine too.  Got to go try!

P.S. I almost forget about the DESSERT!!!!  I'm totally a dessert person -- We had both the sticky rice and mango and the fried banana with coconut ices cream -- Oh! yummy -- I've had these at other Thai restaurants -- but theirs are the best, bar none -- They use coconut gelato -- What can go wrong with that !!! :).
author: Toi D.

description:
The delivery service was fast, but the food was wayyyyy under spiced. Also, it appeared pretty lackluster in comparison to good Thai delivery I've had at home in DC. 

The duck larb was a pleasant surprise--unique flavors and tasty.
author: Kate G.

description: The food and drink options are awesome, although a bit pricey, and there are only a couple of choices for beer. (So, get the wine!) The wrappers for my Fresh Rolls were a bit sticky (had to use a napkin after each piece), but still, they were delicious. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Steve F.

description:
Excellent lunch specials and their service was great. 
I ordered:  Spring Rolls - Excellent!
                    Dan Dan plate - So good! Tangy, not too spicy and the              portions were just right!
                         Love this place. The atmosphere was nice and the prices were good. I left there with a content full stomach! :-)
author: Cesar P.

description:
We've eaten at Sweet Lime many times now and have enjoyed every dish we've tried.  One of our favorites: makhur song kreung -- eggplant, chicken, shrimp in tamarind sauce.

Service is terrific, attentive and efficient.  And the ambiance is casually warm.
author: J K.

description:
I am so glad we found this place. Love the food, the service and the ambiance!!!

I really enjoyed the fresh rolls and the pad thai. 

See you soon.
author: Claudia K.

description:
Neighborhood Neecha has been replaced by Sweet Lime. Still Thai, still simple. Same caliber of food.

TP and I ventured in on a Thursday evening. It was the busiest I'd seen it since it's opening a few weeks back. We were quickly seated by a pretty hostess and give glasses of water with a floating cucumber slice. Nice touch.

We ordered the Pad Ma-Khua ($10) - eggplant in black bean sauce with chicken and the Pad Si-ew ($9) with Tofu - big wide rice noodles stir fried with veggies in soy. Rice per person was $2 for white or brown.

The Pad Ma-Khua was a bit too salty for my taste buds and the chicken got a little tough. There were lots of pieces of chicken but I almost wished for more eggplant instead.

The Pad Si-ew on the other hand was delicious. We couldn't get enough of the soft chewy noodles, the vegetable mix of cabbage, carrots, broccoli and tomato slices. The veggies added a subtle sweetness. There could have been more tofu and would have preferred the fried kind but the fact that we were fighting for the last bites was a good sign.

We didn't have stomach space for the Mango Sticky Rice that I saw on the menu. That in itself would draw me back. While I wouldn't recommend this as a must-try place, it works for the neighborhood.
author: Cindy W.

description: Great service, amazing pad thai, good prices! Loved the decor and the use of orchids on their plating. Will definitely go back!
author: Angela S.

description: VEGETARIANS AND VEGANS BEWARE!  This is a very nice restaurant - lovely ambience, friendly and attentive staff.  I have been eating here since 1991 when it was called Neecha Thai.  At that time, the owner was herself vegetarian so I trusted that there was no fish sauce or chicken stock in anything I ate.  About four years ago, ownership changed yet I was assured that everything I was eating was free of fish sauce and chicken stock.  They even have tofu and seitan (fake meat) options.  And most of their items have a star which indicates the dish can be made vegan.  Sadly, I learned last night that this is not true.  In fact, the server outright said I had been lied to.  This is because ALL of their sauces contain fish sauce and their soups contain chicken stock.  And, apparently all but a few of their dishes contain sauce and cannot be altered.  That is except for a couple of the noodle dishes and special request wok stir-fried items.  I am so sad to report this especially since they are so nice.  In the future, I'll stick with 100% vegetarian Thai restaurants such as Thai Idea on Polk.
author: Richard E.

description: This place has gotten so much better!  The service has improved vastly.  They are so quick and very courteous.  And the food choices have gotten better too!  It's one of my favorite neighborhood joints!
author: Jubi N.

description:
After spending 2 weeks in Thailand and experiencing authentic Thai cuisine, I have been wondering if there was a place in the city that can match up. Sweet lime not only matches up, it exceeded several of the restaurants I dined at while in Thailand.

You can't rate a restaurant without starting with the people that make a great dining experience possible. The staff at Sweet Lime are some of the nicest people you will ever meet. You feel the warmth from everyone as soon as you walk in the doors. if you want to feel some good energy, I would encourage you to walk into Sweet Lime just to see the smiles. 

The Food: We started with the chicken satay and Fresh roll, followed by the Panang Curry and Pad Kra-Prow (from the wok) with beef with brown rice for two. They are not kidding when the say Fresh roll. The vegetables were as fresh as they get. I usually opt for chicken Panang but was told that it is just pork. As pork goes, sometimes it's really good and sometimes it's really bad so I was a little reluctant but we went with it. The pork was AMAZING!!! This stuff melts in your mouth. The Panang sauce was delicious. 

The Pad Kra-Prow was PHENOMENAL. The green beans that accompany the beef were cooked perfectly, with a nice fresh crunch which complimented the soft texture of the beef very well. The beef melts in your mouth as well. 

I have lived in SF for 10 years and maybe I am just lazy but this is my first review. If a dining experience can motivate me enough to want to write a review, I would highly recommend you go check Sweet Lime out. I look forward to my next meal there.

Oh, and the price is right! Happy dining!
author: J F.

description: Decent salmon curry, chicken satay, and mango/sweet rice dessert.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Love the service!  Comfortable ambiance, but most importantly, GREAT food, GREAT flavor!  Please please please, try the fresh rolls, they are amazing!

Enjoy!
author: David M.

description: Had lunch with coworkers here and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dishes. I ordered the Pad Thai which, true to the name, had pleasantly unexpected citrus undertones.  The Sweet Lime touch on classic dishes is very tasty!
author: Kim K.

description: This place has the worst customer service ever! My friends wanted to introduce me to mango sticky rice and we saw this place offered it. When we got there the lady was so rude when we just stated that all we wanted was dessert. Then she made us go to a corner and "sit" while she gets that ready. While waiting, she turned around and asked us if we wanted a plastic bag with an attitude. When the mango sticky rice was ready, they just handed us the box with no napkins or utensils. When we opened it, the rice to mango ratio was askew and the rice was not even traditional sticky rice. Instead, it was black glutinous rice with very little condense milk plopped on top. My first expierence of mango sticky rice was ruined thanks to those two ladies who gave such horrible service. I'm never going to that place again! The only reason why I gave 1 star is because they wouldn't let me post this with 0 stars.
author: stacey a.

description: This was the first time we went to Sweet Lime , it was recommended to us.  OMG!  Was it ever wonderful! The fresh salad rolls were the best I'd ever had, everything was great.  The stuffed egg plant, the noodles , all.  The ice cream with coconut was worth going off any diet.  We cancelled our res. for the next night elsewhere & returned to Sweet lime.  The next day we picked up noodle soup on the way to the airport! Can't wait to go back to S.F so I can go to Sweet Lime!
author: rivian b.

description:
reasonably priced thai food in my neighborhood is all good with me. 

i had chicken pad sew ew. i would go back because of the good location, reasonable prices, decent thai food and quick service
author: Lynee L.

description:
This is a lovely neighborhood Thai restaurant. It's off the beaten track a tiny bit - a couple of blocks from Fillmore and a block off Geary, so it tends to be less crowded and quiet, which works for us because my father is hard-of-hearing. The food is quite good, and we were pleased with everything we ordered, but what i really liked was the friendly service. 
Also, they have the absolute BEST green tea I've ever tasted! When i asked where i could buy it, and was disappointed that it wasn't available in stores, the owner was so sweet -- she went out to the back and dug out a bag of it for me! I kept meaning to write this review to show my appreciation, and finally had a moment today, while sipping some of that great tea! 
I'll definitely be back to Sweet Lime, and recommend it to anyone!
author: Gina S.

description:
I went here last Friday night with some friends for dinner. It was a cold and rainy night, and there's nothing like some good Thai food to warm you up. Started with miang kham, fresh spinach leaves that you put tidbits of onions, dried shrimps, peanuts, peppers and finished off with a ginger tamarind(?) sauce. Very yummy! The sauce was wonderful, sweet and tangy.  Also had some Thai egg rolls, fresh and fried spring rolls. All tasted good.  We then had the papaya salad and the avocado salad. Again, very yummy! Great flavor combination. Very good balance of sweet, sour and salty. The papaya salad is a little spicy, but could use slightly more.  Salads was followed by soups: tom ka and tom yum.  I had a bowl of the tom yum and it was delicious. Again, perfect balance of flavors; however, I had a sip of the tom ka and it was too sweet for me, didn't like it too much. My friends added some chili sauce and it helped balance the sweetness.  For our main dishes, we had choo chee salmon, green curry with beef, vegetarian pad Thai, and pad kee mow.  Both the pad Thai and pad kee mow tasted good. The choo chee salmon was great, slightly rich red curry sauce, and the salmon was cooked perfectly and stood up to the rich sauce!  The green curry was excellent, perfect for a rainy day. For dessert, we had the fried banana, which was ok, and the trio sorbet: coconut, mango and blood orange.  I liked the coconut and mango, very light and  refreshing and great pallet cleanser; but the blood orange, although very fragrant, was a little too bitter for me, overall a good way to end the meal.

Overall, the food was excellent; well balanced flavors.  I talked to the owner, Nee ( not elbow - LOL), and she told me she roasts all the chili herself, all her condiments are made in-house, not bought; also, she tries and buy her herbs and vegetables locally, via the farmers market.  You can tell she cares about the quality of what she serves.  And speaking of "serves", Service was good, very friendly. I highly recommend this place.
author: Jean D.

description: Good quality thai place but I like "My Thai" alittle bit better. "My Thai's" mango salad is much meatier with larger pieces of mango and shrimp. This restaurants mango is very thinly sliced and a much smaller portion with less shrimp. Good quality and good tasting food but I just prefer My Thai over this one. If I was in the area, I wouldn't mind this place.
author: Abra S.

description: Try the Mango Salad and the Chicken Satai ... I enjoyed my experience here, and will surely be back.
author: Eric J.

description:
Venture off the main drag of Fillmore street and you will find this cute little restaurant.
The restaurant is clean, modern, and very cute inside. I love the strands of lights both inside and on the outside trees. This is not your average take out place. The 
presentation of each of the dishes was very fancy. I enjoyed each one of the dishes 
we ordered. Some of my favorites were the Vegan Spring Rolls and Curry Puffs.
Great part was almost all of the dishes can be made vegetarian. Great find, I will be
back.
author: e w.

description:
Some friends and I got take out on a Sat evening...we had yellow curry, a beef noodle dish, and a chicken basil dish...

The food was decent but did not stand out as amazing. For the prices there is so much better thai food out there or just as good for cheaper. The menu (takeout) was a little confusing lunch vs dinner prices and slightly different items.

I probably will no be going back unless I'm desperate for thai and don't want to walk to another place. (I live 4 blocks away)
author: Kris B.

description: If you read somewhere that they deliver to locations within 3 miles, it's a lie. Don't waste your time.
author: Horrible H.

description: I wish I could give either no stars or minus stars!!!  First off, I want to start by saying that I use to order from this restaurant very frequently.  Since I work at 2 local hospitals, one can imagine just how many times a week that we order out between both facilities.  I went online to place an order last night when I realized that they changed and now use either EAT24 or Grubhub for delivery services ( you can not call the restaurant directly anymore like before ).  So, I chose EAT24.  However, this review has nothing to do with them ( they were actually the only ones who were apologetic, helpful and attentive to my problems / issues ).  The first issue was with the pad thai.  I had originally marked mild on the online order but then called directly back to the restaurant to see if they could make it medium.  So, when my co-worker tasted the food it it was so unbelievably spicy that he couldn't even eat it ( no exaggeration and also told me because he is from Thailand originally he can tolerate spicy fairly well but that this was just out of the park unbearable! )  After taking just one bite, he then began coughing, terrible watery eyes and couldn't even speak!  He had also ordered the thai ice drink and literally downed it within seconds but continued to suffer for a good 10 mins or more afterwards.  For the most part bay area local Thai restaurants usually are have 3 levels of spicy - mild, medium and thai hot/spicy.  SOOOOO, I then now had to make a second call to let EAT24 regarding that which will forever be known as " broccoli gate ".  When I called the second time the gal from EAT24 informed me that she has to wait for the manager of the restaurant ( who may be in around 9 - 9:30 p.m. or later that evening ) to see what could be done.  I personally typed in the instruction box that **  NO BROCCOLI ON, IN OR AROUND THE PAD SI-EW ( IF YOUR NOT GOING TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS THAT HAVE BEEN TYPED IN, THEN WHY GIVE THE IMPRESSION THAT IT IS BEING PAID ATTENTION AND ADHERED TOO  ). Well, guess what they put broccoli in the entree and the person that ordered that item took one whiff and though new right away what had happened because broccoli makes her vomit and nauseous.  The restaurant told us to just pick out the broccoli ( I mean according to them, it wasn't really such a big deal to start with and with a very simple solution but yet no solution for the overly hot and of course inedible pad thai ).  Unfortunately by then the smell and overall taste had permeated the entire dish and it was inedible for her.  The gal @ EAT24 said she would probably email with the restaurant response since it was late in the evening.  I checked this morning my email for a response from EAT24.  There was no such email so I decided to give them a call. The gentleman from EAT24 that I spoke with read me the notes on the account.  He said that this restaurant refuses to take any responsibility for their mistakes ( even a credit perhaps or even another delivery of the right food order, etc. )  That would have been the right response to these problems in order to end these issues.  So, I not only wasted $30.00 ( which I think that this restaurant is really, really, really overpriced and over inflated considering incorrect orders, small portions, etc ).  So, my co-workers I am sure will be truly disappointed but I refuse to give them anymore of my business.  Obviously customer service is not a notion that they obviously understand nor will ever deliver.  Their food is mediocre at best and certainly not worth my time or my effort!  For a place of business that does not stand by their mistakes and want to right the wrong it is not a place that I want my hard earned dollars to go to or for people like that to profit!!!
author: COLLEEN C.

description: This restaurant right here is one of our favorites at the job...Coworkers come together and eat good, fresh food.  This place has never disappointed us!  Since we always come here for lunch--we get the privilege of eating good food that doesn't hurt our pockets. When suggestions come up 4 out of 5 of us mention this place.  I love the yellow chicken curry lunch special.  You get a salad with rice and bowl of chicken curry.  MMMM..so good.  Ambiance is nice, service is good, what  else could a person want?   Oh did I mention that they serve vegetarian, gluten free food!
author: Cherry C.

description: Very friendly and helpful staff, great location, clean and interesting restaurant, as well as quick takeout...
author: Mike S.

description: Ordered delivery so may have been a different experience but the food was terrible. Four of us ordered food and each meal was bland and dissappointing. Ordered a dish very spicy and wasn't spicy at all.
author: Rohan S.

description: Delicious! Not only is this place right across the street from me, it's fast and cheap! The service...meh, but for $10 you get a healthy serving of practically anything you like. If you're going to Japantown and don't want Ramen or Sushi... Sweet Lime is a great choice! Shout outs to the people who love the spicy Cashew Chicken!
author: Dylan B.

description: Great food.. Great staff.. Very friendly. Pad see yoo is delicious.. Have been here a few times with a friend and they remember us each time!! It really stands out on the Fillmore area as a ace for a good quick dinner after a long work day!! One of my regular places to catch a bite to eat!
author: Cathy F.

description: Is there a way to give 0 stars? I've ordered from this restaurant twice. First time I used their online ordering option for delivery about a year ago. They messed up the order. I decided to try again tonight- this time I called to place the order for delivery since I wanted to be sure they couldn't mess it up. I called after an hour and 15 minutes of waiting and impressively, they lost the order. IMHO this restaurant doesn't even merit 1 star.
author: Beth S.

description: We had a gathering of over 25 friends from nearby St. Dominic's Catholic Church.  All  of us have eaten here before with each other, or small groups of 2 or 4.  The table was laid out nicely for us but the prior arrangements for the time and details of their $15.00 corkage fee left us having second thoughts about having a party here. They kept wanting us to order family style, so it would be less work for the kitchen, and I told them that is not possible because some of us can't tolerate peanuts, curry or coconut.  They wanted us to pre-order before the party but their menu is not online, you have to download an app.  The upshot is management didn't want our large party, which ended up in a nice hefty bill for alcohol and food.  We have had parties at other restaurants in the 'hood who welcome us and don't impose these restrictions.
author: Elizabeth s.

description: Today was a second time I had to go back for their desserts. If you like banana. You got to try their fried banana with ice cream. The ice cream is really good and the fried banana is not a greasy deep fried as you think.  I really have to give them a 5 stars on deep fried banana as it is super crunchy with thin wrap and got along well with the sweet taste from ice cream.   Also their sticky rice with mango is very promising. If you like mango. This is very good combination of black sticky rice with coconut milk on the top. None of their desserts are too sweet. Great taste!!!  I definitely will go back again for their foods.
author: Risa C.

description: This is some of the best, most consistent Thai around. Humble spot, good service, and delish. Red curry and fresh rolls are my faves. Good wine list. Great spot for lunch. Not the cheapest, but worth it as the food is always fresh and yummy.
author: Jenny K.

description: Really tasty food and super friendly service. I've had red curry, green curry, pad thai, pad see ew, fresh rolls, and spicy green beans - all very good. I love that they don't hold back on the spice. Plus, they're brown rice is really really good.
author: L S.

description: This is a wonderful place to come for dinner (eat in or take away). I give the service 5 stars- the owners are so attentive and the customer absolutely comes first here. The food is also the best Thai I have had yet in the city. I would give them an extra star if I could because they don't use MSG. Nice!!! We ate here last night and had the Massaman Curry and Panang Curry and an Avocado Salad. The Massaman and Salad were *great* but the Panang Curry was literally *the best Panang I have ever had* (and I love me some curry so I have had a lot!). This is one of those places that you almost don't want to yelp about to keep it to yourself.... but it is just too good, I had to share. Keep up the good work Sweet Lime and enjoy SF Thai foodies :)
author: Saray D.

description: My family just enjoyed a memorable meal at Sweet Lime Thai Cuisine, a quaint neighborhood restaurant in a nice area. All 4 dishes and dessert were prepared beautifully, with quality ingredients. We started off with freshly made watermelon juice, blended with ice, next, we had a great salad, greens with black sesame and balsamic vinegarette dressing, sweet/sour coconut soup with tofu was excellent, fresh salmon (a chef favorite), was excellent with some of the best sauce I have ever had; we finished the meal with sorbet, blood orange, mango and coconut. The service was impeccable.  This restaurant is a great find!
author: Jan F.

description: it's very good. it's not "great".  the prices are about 20% higher than they should be all things considered (that it's SF, and the environment, service, the food). But I can see how a lot of people here say "good prices" because they are probably locals who pay $$$ in rent or own and compared to other nicely appointment rather good restaurants in the area this is a reasonable place. the hostesses are particularly nice. count on about $20-$25 per person plus drinks.
author: Nip B.

description: Super fresh, wonderful people, creative dishes. Yum!
author: Lori H.

description: Eh, it's okay! Me and the hubs were content with the meal but not ecstatic! I think I will keep my search on for good Thai food.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
The food here is incredible. Its not like some places where the dishes all taste somewhat similar. Each dish we ordered and shared was unique and exquisite. I loved Neecha but I think Sweet Lime has raised the bar.

There were 3 of us with healthy appetites and with tax our bill was $63 - starter, salad, entrees and dessert. It's not a cheap eats kind of place, but for the quality of food and the location the prices seem on par.

Service was great, dishes came out quickly but not too quickly, i.e. we were able to eat our starter and salad before our entress came out. The owner stopped by at the end and thanked us. They also brought us beautifully sliced mango and strawberries at the end of our meal.

The fresh rolls and avocado salad were my favorite, but all of the dishes were very delicious and memorable. I will be back again and again.
author: Ste B.

description: This place is one of the nicer Thai restaurants I have been to.  First of all, the surroundings are very peaceful - and you feel like you can sit down, relax, have a nice meal and not be hurried through.  So, we went for lunch on a Saturday - wasn't very busy probably because there is a brunch place across the street.  We had the Duck Larb, Curry Puffs, Avocado Salad, and a few Singhas.  The Duck Larb was outstanding - I've had this dish with beef and chicken, but never duck.  Really good.  Curry Puff was delicious and the presentation was beautiful with slices of green apple and a dipping sauce.  Our waiter was great.  He timed everything perfectly and was a really nice guy.  I look forward to going back at dinnertime.
author: Tapedeck B.

description: This place is AWESOME. This is a great restaurant to go to before a show at the Fillmore. They really do offer "service with a smile" and the food is super yummy. I had the Pad Thai and shared it with my boyfriend who had the yellow curry---both VERY good. This place was excellent. I will definitely go again the next time I'm going to a concert at the Fillmore. I seriously cannot believe that anyone would give it less than 4 or 5 stars. Highly recommended!
author: GreenEyez M.

description:
Nee, the lady who owns and runs this jewel of a place, is a total charmer - her smile, genuine hospitality and warmth sets the tone for the meal.  How Sweet Lime elevates itself from the pack of generic, bland, cookie-cutter Thai restaurants is the quality of the ingredients.
They use fresh, pristine ingredients - resulting in food that sparkles.  The Pad Thai and the Pad See Eu, for instance, usually boring and formulaic elsewhere, here taste bright, fresh. The restaurant offers 3 different house-made fresh chili sauces offered to go with the dishes, depending on one's proclivity and/or tolerance to spice.  There is a feeling which permeates this place that a whole lot of love and care went into everything served here, including the wine program, which is also stellar--the offerings are not the typical, run-of-the-mill cheapo wines usually found in Asian restaurants, but rather, some expertise was imparted in the way the list was conceptualized.  Intelligent and fun, with a few quirks thrown in for good measure.  The space itself is clean, cheery and - dare I say again -  SPARKLES.  This place is a true find.
author: Angelo S.

description: Extremely friendly staff, and great value.  We tried 2 curry dishes, both were delicious.  I wish I lived closer so I could go more often.  I'd recommend giving them a try!
author: Adam S.

description: I was blown away by this wonderful restaurant.  The hostess and the waiters were enthusiastic, happy to see us, and extraordinarily helpful as we decided what to order.  It was my girlfriend's birthday, and the hostess brought her a dessert with a candle, and had the whole restaurant singing "happy birthday" to her!  Also, the pineapple fried rice comes in a half-pineapple.  So cute.  Outstanding food, wonderful service, and affordable pricing.
author: Alicia N.

description: Not the worst Thai food we've had around here, but also not the best. The Thai iced tea was bitter and way too milky...I would definitely not go back here.
author: Cami J.

description: Extremely friendly staff, modern look, and sticky rice with mango that's so good I've been dreaming about it for weeks... I'd go here again in a heartbeat!
author: Cate X.

description:
Outstanding Thai food from a wide menu, a worthy successor to the long-lived Neecha formerly at this location.

Among starters, the Fresh Roll (all raw vegetables and herbs) was amazingly good, and Spicy Angel Wings were crispy with a mild chili garlic sauce and deep-fried basil leaves.  From the Chef's Favorites, the Makhur Song Krueng was a whole small peeled eggplant stuffed with bits of chicken and shrimp with a mild tamarind sauce, very savory; Sweet and Sour Roasted Duck included a lot of delicious pieces of duck with lots of fresh ginger and some spinach.  Pad (that is, "stir-fried") Broccoli was a nice surprise when it included green broccoli, white cauliflower, and purple broccoli with shiitake mushrooms in a light sauce.  Each dish had a different flavor, but all the sauces were greaseless and light enough to feature the meats and vegetables (which were not overcooked).  Everything made a great family-style meal to share.

Service was very attentive and intelligent.  The management welcomes your own wine for corkage service, a most-appreciated policy which helps any restaurant to fit a wider variety of occasions and customers.

Neecha's many frequent customers from the neighborhood should definitely give Sweet Lime a try.  Life is not going to be as disappointing as it first seemed when Neecha closed; there will be good Thai food on wet nights this winter after all.
author: Robert G.

description:
My girlfriend and I always end up defaulting to Sweet Lime Thai when we can't decide where we want to go. 
Each time we've gone in they are incredibly nice. One time they saw that I was cold so they brought a mug of warm water to warm up my hands.
Very well priced, and great food. Make sure to check out the Makhur Song Krueng which is an entire eggplant and quite sweet. The pineapple rice is served in an half pineapple.
author: Tyke L.

description: Sweet Lime hosted our wedding rehearsal dinner and we were thrilled with the service and food. Management worked with our budget to create an excellent meal that everyone enjoyed. It was a special weekend and Sweet Lime was a perfect choice for us! We no longer live in SF but Sweet Lime is still one of our fav places for dinner in the city. So yummy!
author: Alex K.

description: Not too far from my relative's house in Pacific Heights. Its been over a year since I've ate at Sweet Lime Thai Cuisine. The food was delicious. Vegetarian Friendly. Nice, quiet, and cozy ambiance. Service was great too.
author: Gwendolyn M.

description:
- food: basic yet tasty
- atmosphere: nondescript
- staff: very friendly
- price: cheap

additional info:
- fast, quality, Thai food
author: J. B.

description: Pretty good food. Some of the tastes are slightly out of balance in the food. Would come back.
author: Dan W.

description: Had a great experience here last night.  Came in around 7PM on a Saturday night, didn't have a reservation and they were able to seat us in 5 minutes.  The food is very good and reasonably priced ($12 plates).  The staff is really friendly and attentive.  Will definitely be back.  It is a little warm in the restaurant, so make sure to wear something light once you get inside!
author: C B.

description: Came here for dinner with a friend in June 2013. We ordered the tom kha soup and chicken pad thai. Both delicious. Loved the ambiance; service was very friendly; prices were appropriate. Found easy (free) parking a block or two over on Scott St. Will definitely be back!
author: Elle G.

description:
Ordered take out from Sweet Lime.  Food was underwhelming, especially the Som Tam (papaya salad) was virtually inedible and did not appear to be fresh.

We both also felt slightly nauseous about 1 hour afterwards.
author: Clay B.

description: I live in neighborhood and have gone to this place several times both to dine in and for takeout. Food is very good and I think much better than the previous Thai restaurant that was at this location. The staff is nice and the food is out very quickly. Yellow curry with a side of brown rice is my go-to order. Defintely give this spot a try.
author: Dan H.

description:
really great service, the food was DELICIOUS - my default (pad see ew) was awesome & the portion size was good. prices were typical and the ambiance was good for a business meeting or date, or just night out w/ the ladies! 
close to Kabuki theater (so great place for dinner then a movie :) will definitely return!
author: linda t.

description: The fried rice dish with the egg on top was exactly like the ubiquitous dish found everywhere in Thailand.  Nicely done!  Good food, nice staff and comfortable surroundings. Next time I want to try the Panang.  I hope they continue to thrive.
author: Eve C.

description: Just had a most fabulous dinner here. The eggplant chef favorite was good and the sweet and sour roast duck was excellent. I also loved the little deep fried spring rolls. Even though we didn't order dessert they brought us a small bowl of coconut tapioca with apricot jam. Service was excellent and the ambience was lovely. Loved the brown rice in a heart shape too - nice touch.
author: Janet P.

description:
Love this place. It's pretty, off the beaten path (Fillmore) and has great service and food. My friend and I had a meal each, with an app for $35, you can't beat that for a Friday night dinner in a city. 

Great food, great service, great price. Awesome place! highly recommend it.
author: Sandra R.

description: I've had a few of the curries and the pad khing. All were excellent. The flavors and ingredients here are very well done. They don't over do it and overwhelm the dishes. Everything is nicely balanced and the flavors are precise. You can taste each thing that is in there. And if you get rice it is a filling meal (even for a big guy) for a reasonable price.
author: Chris M.

description: Had dinner tonight at sweet lime as always dinner was great.  Staff was very pleasant.  Food was exceptional.  Will be back as much as possible.  Best Thai food in the city.  People that put 2 stars on here must either have no taste or be owners of competing thai reataurants.
author: Britton W.

description: Nice owner. Great pad thai!!
author: Michael F.

description:
Enjoyed this spot in Laurel village and the thai food was fresh and authentic versus other options in the area.

Both dishes that I split with my girlfriend were great - the Pad Broccoli and Pad Si-Ew were both recommended by our server and didn't disappoint.

Another touch that made us feel at home was the Owner/Chef came out to talk to us and asked us about our meal which rarely happens in San Francisco.
author: Michael A.

description: Loved this place, the red curry was delicious! Everything was fresh and served with a beautiful orchid. The salmon dish with curry was just as good.  Great place to eat, right before you hit the kabuki to see a movie!
author: Pug P.

description: Not so impressed.  Was really excited about a new Thai place on the corner across from where I live, but won't be ordering from here again.  The pad thai tastes a little sour and the tofu in there tastes very fishy.  The yellow curry was good.  The thai iced coffee was a little bitter and with crushed ice, so it's just gets watered down.  One plus was the yellow curry, it has a good flavor, but some of the chicken in it was gray....how does chicken get gray?  That's not good.  Also, service was great.  No issues there.  I did get the food to go but there were quite a few people there and they seemed pretty attentive.
author: Prakash R.

description:
This is our go to for Thai food!  We love the food and the great service.  We take our kids, too and they are sooo accomodating for them--including one with food allergies.  The pad thai noodles are too die for; the squid was my son's fave; the avocado salad is so good as well. 
Don't miss this spot!
author: hilah s.

description:
If there ever was a gem, Sweet Lime Thai is one! The owner, Thassanee (aka Nee), has years of history in fine dining and brings a little extra something along with some of the best vendors for quality ingredients. 

Nee and her staff took wonderful care of our little party when we needed a place to celebrate and they took great care of my husband and I when we just wanted delicious food. It is perfect for take out or whatever the need. Fabulous food, great service and always with a smile!

We will indeed return and so should you!
author: Mama L.

description: I was there with one of my good friends. I have been at so many Thai restaurants, but I think this is one of my top five favorite Thai restaurants. We started with fresh egg rolls (five full stars for that), and I absolutely loved the Pad Thai dish. I really felt that they treated me like a guest and not a customer. The restaurant is really nice and clean and the staff is really helpful. It is like a quick trip to Chiang Mai eventhough you are in San Francisco. I will come back again with other friends.
author: Saadi N.

description: definitely was not impressed with the food. service was good but food really was not that great. the only reason i went here was because it was one of the few places open after i couldn't get into another restaurant because of the wait. jitlada thai cuisine which is a few streets down is worth the walk and much better than this place.
author: Anish P.

description: The food has gotten a lot better here in the last 2 years. However, the restaurant often smells bad. Also make sure you get in really early before they close because they will usher you out the door. We showed up at 9:35 for dinner and were declined a table because they said the kitchen closed at 9:45. They lady was nice but the male server was very rude.
author: dina d.

description:
thai culture is known around the world for providing excellent service & here at Sweet Lime they do just that!   but they don't stop there,  they continue their excellence w/ the wide selection of tasty thai cuisine.
we arrived hungry & sampled many of their dishes from appetizers to soups, to a main onto noodles & of course a couple of desserts.  from one course to the next,  Sweet Lime did not disappoint.  we look forward to another delicious evening at our new favorite thai restaurant.
thank you ladies of Sweet Lime.
author: sandie g.

description: Similar to another reviewer less than a month ago, I also experience very rude service from the male server (and really little better from the woman).  The food is ok but very overpriced (even for the slightly cheaper lunch menu).  I have definitely had better with MUCH better service.  I did come in towards the end of the lunch service, but two other tables came AFTER me and seemed to receive much better service (although their server was the woman).  Not only did he not explain any of the specials (or really anything at all) but he just plopped down the stack of menus took some forks off the table and walked away.  Then, after I ordered, when I overheard the woman actually explaining the specials to a different table, I explained that had I known the $3 special came with an appetizer and a salad I would have ordered that and not the $2.50 salad only add-on.  She informed me, "oh well, maybe next time."  Oh no, there will be no next time.  I already knew the $2.50 was waaay too much for that poor excuse of a salad but I was willing to pay it so that I could have something leafy green.  Really? $2.50 for a handful of mixed lettuce (not baby greens either) a drizzle of balsamic and some little rice noodles on top, I think not.  Suffice it to say the experience not only ruined my meal but also my afternoon.  Now I must fill my belly with a delicious caffeinated beverage to soothe my soul.  Thanks but no thanks, Sweet Lime Thai.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Just discovered this place tonight and it was amazing!  My husband and I have struggled to find a Thai restaurant that we both like in our neighborhood, and finally we found one.  We ate there tonight with my parents.  We tasted 4 entrees, Thai iced tea, 2 appetizers, and 2 desserts and everything had us ooing and awwwing.  The food was fresh and delicious, and the presentation was beautifully displayed, including orchids on the dessert plates. The owner and our waitress were also both so sweet, making the experience comfortable and fun.  

The only thing that could make it better is if they delivered!  We will definitely be going back!!!
author: heather i.

description: I do not know much about thai food but the appetizers (steak salad and fresh rolls) were really good and the Pad Si-Ew was great.  The reason for the five stars was the service and the price was reasonable(6 people with appetizers for under $100).  Owner and servers were very friendly and we were able to bring in our own bottle of wine with no corking fee.  Desert was good and the caramel that the owner makes was very tasty.
author: Joseph C.

description:
WOW I met an old friend and had no idea what to expect for lunch. I love Thai food and have been to Thailand and have a pretty good idea of what good Thai food is. I was soo impressed with the first dish that at that moment I realized I was in for something special. The shrimp were served raw and were so fresh and tasty with the colorful presentation I wish I could post the picture..it was delicious-I later found out that the owner went to the market earlier that day shopping for fish..then the spring rolls and peanut dipping sauce with a generous portion of perfectly ripe avocado were a soothing break before we had one of the best pad thai's I've had this side of Bangkok. Why can'y I make this at home?? The final dish was a special fried whole sea bass. Delicious, can't wait to go back!
Great food, friendly and efficient service.
author: Michael H.

description: This place was going to get 4 stars (a round up from 3.5) until I found some sort of cricket type guy in my soup. Not cool.
author: Cathleen M.

description: Love this restaurant. Great ambiance & decor, wonderful service, & great layout of dishes. Must try the 'kra thong tong' crispy golden cup & curry puff appetizer. Panang curry has very tender pork, you would want to finish the whole plate. Highly recommended. Food is very fresh with no msg. For desert, sticky rice with mango tasted delicious with tons of mangos :)
author: Mary Y.

description:
Finally an authentic Thai kitchen.
Friends suggested we try this place and it was a wonderful experience.
The server was so friendly as Thai folks are, knowledgable and suggested various great dishes for us to share. We had an amazing array of food and that include the red Trout, the banana wrapped Salmon and a veggie curry dish and a chicken curry dish. The optional spices offered tasted as if I were in Bangkok. Good luck in this lovely place.
My only destination in SF for Thai food from now on.
author: Charles C.

description: sucks. Chicken dish had probably 2 oz of chicken that fell off a sysco truck covered in cheap rice and nothing else. Salad portions are tiny. Spring rolls are basically french fries - have nothing in them. Nothing exceptional about anything I've had here. Plenty of other good Thai places in the neighborhood.
author: Joseph E.

description: In a city with 98574569787697 thai restaurants, Sweet Lime is a standout for being clean and nice (unlike the grimier joints downtown) and unpretentious (unlike the oshas of the world). The food is extremely well-prepared, and the menu is extensive enough that you can pop in for a simple mango salad and pad thai, or go with a group of friends and get fancier with grilled salmon and cornish game hen. To top it off, they  have a nice little beer and wine list and  the staff are extremely sweet and attentive.
author: Stacie W.

description: really friendly good service. they have a $15 minimum for credit cards but because i was unaware, they let me use my card for a purchase of $9 for this one time without a fuss. the pad thai was tasty. there was something extra in there that i'm not used it. it had a bit of a crunch and tasted like something either preserved or pickled.
author: Regina C.

description: i decided to come here solely based on the 4-star ratings. however, i should've heeded some of the 2-star ratings because they were spot on in terms of the reviews. the food was just way too heavy on the salt and sugar. i felt bad for introducing my parents to such terrible thai food. i should've just went to my neighborhood hole-in-the-wall. i'm sorry to leave such a harsh review but i was just so disappointed in the food.
author: Erin M.

description: This is the first review I've ever written, but I keep seeing people say how great this place is. The people here are very nice, but the food is not very good, it's so so, I wouldn't want anyone expecting amazing food. I live across the street and keep trying different dishes in hope of something good because it is so close, but it is mediocre at best. There is another place on Buchanan that is much better.
author: A t.

description: Amazing expierence at sweet lime the other night. The food was amazing the service was great and the owner Thassanne was so welcoming and a great delight! I was very impressed with the wine list we had a nice glass of Riesling and a bottle of Bella Glos Pinot Nior at great prices. Very impressed!
author: Antonio P.

description: Excellent food!  The best Pad Thai ever; the shrimp was perfectly cooked and their tofu was wonderful. There fresh rolls are very good too. I have never liked Thai Iced Tea but on the insistence of my friend I had it.  It was full of crushed ice and not as sweet as everywhere else I have had it. I am taking a friend back this week.
author: Connie M.

description: The food is pretty good but they INEVITABLY get something wrong with to-go orders. This has happened every single time I've ordered to go there, and at this point it's comical. Brown rice instead of white rice; I ask if I can pay by credit card and they say yes on the phone and no in person; the order is incomplete... When I catch the mistake the owner is apologetic, but look, I'm ordering to go because time is of the essence and I can't be bothered to lose mine while you correct your repeated mistakes.
author: Masha G.

description: Why is it so hard to find a restaurant that makes good Pad Thai?  Considering this is a new place to the neighborhood we were very excited to try it out in the hopes of supporting the restaurant on a regular basis.  We called in a dinner order for pick up, chicken pad thai and chicken in red curry.  When we asked what is served with the curry, they commented nothing, just the curry.  WTF?  No rice?  Oh yes, you can order rice, but it doesn't come with it.  How can a curry dish not be served with rice?  I shared with the server that they should consider adding rice to curry dishes as it seems odd to not have anything else with it.  Last I checked, curry is not a soup.  Okay, whatever.  So I picked up the food and was optimistic about possibly finding a new Thai restaurant to frequent.  Upon opening the bag of food, I was immediately disappointed by the food.  The red curry dish looked as if it had been filled and then emptied out, almost as if too much had originally been placed in the container.   Lots of sauce, which was sweeter than other red curries I am use to and had little chicken and veggies.   The box of rice was the smallest I had ever seen and somewhat of a joke.  Last I checked, rice is cheap, why be so stingy?  Next, the pad thai that I was so looking forward to and unfortunately, deeply disappointed.  The dish was very oily, no nice browning on the noodles and for some reason all of the noodles stuck together.  Lots of chicken in the pad thai which was nice, but very little as far as bean sprouts, green onions, etc.  All and all, we were both very disappointed and won't be running back anytime soon.  This is so unfortunate since this is new to the neighborhood.  Maybe the breakfast/lunch place across from Sweet Lime will be better and one that we will support.
author: Runner G.

description: great veg food and will make foood the way you ask. Love it
author: Lisa B.

description: Excellent chicken pad thai. Best I ever had in fact. They put little bits of pickled radish in there which makes it even more tasty. Wontons in the wonton soup - not so good. Rad Nah - not so good. Those are all the dishes I tried. Good service. I like that the owner checks on every table.
author: Lisa F.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant!  Dishes are full of fresh vegetables, delicately seasoned (spicy dishes are marked - tell the server if you don't want it too spicy), and beautifully presented.  My favorite entrees are the yellow curry (chicken or lamb), ginger salmon, and pad thai.  The fresh roll is a tasty, light appetizer.  Service is delightful, and it's quiet enough to have a conversation here.  And it's such a pretty place.  At these prices, it's a great value, and  I'll keep coming back for more!  They also have excellent carry-out.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Our family was excited to see a new restaurant replace Neecha, as we live across the street.  We really like the food, and this is now a go-to restaurant for us in the neighborhood.  The prices are good too--hard to find in this neighborhood.
author: David L.

description: Food is fantastic and priced well.  The servers are super friendly and while sometimes I don't undertand what they're saying to me, in a weird way it sort of adds to the dining experience.
author: James R.

description: great neighborhood restaurant. wings, ny steak salad, and snapper salad a must. also, can't go wrong with the pad siew..pretty money. dessert menu is super solid and the service is great and personable. owner is adorable...it doesn't get friendlier than this staff.
author: Carl F.

description: We were long time customers of Neecha Thai, although in truth the food had become less consistently good toward the end.  When Sweet Lime took over, we gave it a few months to shake out the kinks.  Last night we went there for dinner.  What an improvement!  Not only does the place look a lot better, but the food blows the socks off of anything Neecha ever produced.  We had a couple of starters, the miang kham which you have to experience for yourself, and spring rolls that were a lot thinner and better than any others I've had.  Really good. We then went on to the red curry with duck and pineapple (hot and very tasty), the pad pak ruam mit with shrimp (another good one) and the pad prick sod (I'm not making that up) with chicken.  All the dishes were very flavorful and beautifully presented.  As it was our daughter's birthday, we ordered dessert .  We all had something different and they were all terrific.  I would recommend this spot to anyone.
author: D N.

description: I am from Thailand and was visiting town from Oregon for thanksgiving. Both I & my friends were very impressed and satisfied with this restaurant. We started with a couple appetizers.  The first appetizer was a fresh roll with avocado and peanut source.  It is very good especially the peanut source taste authentic just like when I had it in Thailand.  The second appetizer was 'Kra Thong Tong' with crispy golden cup and curry puff.  I love this because it is very fresh and crisp.  It made me wonder where they get it from, when asked we found out that the owner makes this herself!  The Pad Thai is great, it is not dry and saucy.  My most favorite dish is Mussaman curry beef.  It comes with beef tenderloin just like how they serve it in Thailand.  The taste is exactly the same.  It is very authentic.  I have been to many Thai restaurants in Oregon and California, and Sweet Lime by far has the best Mussaman curry in the United States.  The beef tenderloin is so tender.  We didn't even need a knife to cut it.  You must try this one!  I will definitely order this curry again while I am visiting next time!
author: Chian R.

description: This is a neighborhood gem!!  Small, personal, friendly and attentive service with great food.  There is obvious care and attention to the preparation and presentation of the fresh and creative dishes.  I am a fish eating vegetarian and the menu had many options for me.  We thoroughly enjoyed the fresh vegetarian rolls with peanut sauce, the papaya salad that was just the right amount of spicy and crunchy, a vegetable green curry with a variety of vegetables including kabocha squash, a delicious red snapper topped with chopped green apple and other crisp veggies that again, made for a great taste contrast and complimented the fish.  We ended with the sticky rice and mango dessert that was a light and yummy ending to the meal.  Also, did take out for our daughter at home who gave a Chefs Special with chicken, pork, beef, and peppers in a spicy sauce a big thumbs up.  As more and more neighbors discover this restaurant, it will become a local favorite!
author: Bev L.
